subject: RE: Are you free for a call? Andrea moved our meeting to now
body:
Nicole – I can take a few screenshots to show you what happens, hopefully that will help. (I’m using Aflac just as my example here, I’ve reverted this already so the changes aren’t actually in the system.) 
 
Step 0: Client has a prepayment balance on file
 
 
Step 1: Add the cancel/postpone charge to the SOW, then create an invoice for it – example $1,000
 
 
Step 2: When saving the invoice, Scoro pops this up and we click yes (this happens every time we use prepayment on an invoice)
 
 
Step 2.5: Prepayment has been reduced in Scoro by that amount: 43k – 1k = 42k
 
 
Step 3: If we have agreed to refund the rest of the prepayment, they will get back this new amount shown (which will be processed manually). I will move things internally to zero out the balance on file once it’s paid back, then take similar actions inside QB to match the records.
 
Hope that helps!
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW

 - Sarah's rate is $30/hr. LMK if you need more info. (I'm awaiting her W9).
 
Thank you!
 
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Wednesday, April 2, 2025 9:18 AM
To:
 
sj93@outlook.com
 <
sj93@outlook.com
>
Subject:
 Onboarding info - LCW
 
 
Good morning, Sarah,
 
I'm super excited to have you start! Here's a long email with lots of info! 
🙂
 
To get you set up, attached please find our 
Contactor Agreement 
for your signature. You just need to add your address under 9.g & fill in the "Contractor" box on the last page. You can sign electronically. LMK if you have any issues with the form.
 
I've also attached a 
W9
 form for you to send in case you don't have one already. Please send this back.
 
And I attached the
 job description
 again just to have everything in one place 
🙂
.
 
Please send your 
resume
 when you get a moment.
 
I got your 
LCW email
 set up. See attached image. Email is: 
s.jordan@lcwmail.com
. Your current PW is Password: H&420715447080ud . When you log in, it will ask you to reset your password. 
Up to you, but I use office 365 online (instead of downloading the app). You can use either. LMK if you have any issues getting in.
 
Lastly, I will need your banking information. I will send a separate email about that & will introduce you to our bookkeeper, Sarah (they/them) - who we call SG 
🙂
. We will give you instructions on how to fill out your timesheet for payment (which is every 2 weeks).
 
One more thing...
I'd love to chat again to explain a bunch of things about LCW
 & how we work, etc.
I have time tomorrow (Thurs) at 9am or at 4pm. Or I can do Mon from 2pm onward. LMK what works for you!
I will also put you in touch with Kaitlin so she can explain the tasks she does (Zoom stuff, scheduling, training evaluations, etc.). 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need anything else in the meantime.
Thanks so much! 
Nicole

subject: RE: {External} 10 March "Leading Inclusively" for EMEA
body:
Hi RP – you can let her know that I’ve applied the prepayment to the full balance of the current invoice, so nothing is due now. They can reject or void out the invoice in Ariba.
 
Based on the dates in Compass, it looks like they will use up the prepayment on this SOW in September, so we’ll start invoicing them again at that point. If those dates are solid, I can schedule it internally to record the prepayment used, just let me know.
 
SG

Hi Shani,
Yes, good question. We’ve changed our invoicing methodology to better align with the way the SOWs are actually prepaid, spread out over the actual deliverables. 
However, if this doesn’t work for y’all, I’m happy to have the invoice I just sent Evan voided and we can go back to the old process where we draw on your prepayment until it runs out. 
Copying our Accounting department here.
Thoughts?
Rebecca

Hi 
@Rebecca Parrilla
, would you be able to clarify why we are moving away from the practice of charging sessions to the Prepay until we reach the total amount of the prepay with sessions held?
 
That is the approach we used last year. 
 
For example, we prepaid $90,779  in Feb 2024 and all sessions up until June/Sep 2024 were covered in the prepay, then we started paying for the rest of sessions after that.

Hi Sarah, welcome to the team!
 
Attached is the time sheet for this quarter (I’ll send out a new one to all hourly folks at the end of June). You will fill this out and submit twice a month to Nicole for approval, after the 15
th
 and the last of the month. Payment is processed at the end of the following period – so for this period April 1
st
 to 15
th
, you’ll be paid on May 1
st
, as long as I got the approval in time to schedule it on the run.
 
We make contractor payments using QuickBooks Online ACH. I just sent you an invitation email to create an account and manage your own bank information, which can also be used to access your Form 1099 at year end. If you didn’t get that email, you can click this link:
 
https://signup.quickbooks.intuit.com/index.html?locale=en-US&offerId=20026530&offerType=trial&product=qbmoney&username=sej93%40outlook.com&flowId=us-qbmoney-b2b-trial&payeeId=262c19fc-739c-4396-883b-06c7261d2521&senderCompanyName=Language+%26+Culture+Worldwide%2C+LLC

th

Best,

🙂
 
To get you set up, attached please find our 
Contactor Agreement 
for your signature. You just need to add your address under 9.g & fill in the "Contractor" box on the last page. You can sign electronically. LMK if you have any issues with the form.

W9

🙂
.

resume

LCW email
 set up. See attached image. Email is: 
s.jordan@lcwmail.com

Up to you, but I use office 365 online (instead of downloading the app). You can use either. LMK if you have any issues getting in.
 
Lastly, I will need your banking information. I will send a separate email about that & will introduce you to our bookkeeper, Sarah (they/them) - who we call SG 
🙂
. We will give you instructions on how to fill out your timesheet for payment (which is every 2 weeks).
 
One more thing...
I'd love to chat again to explain a bunch of things about LCW
 & how we work, etc.
I have time tomorrow (Thurs) at 9am or at 4pm. Or I can do Mon from 2pm onward. LMK what works for you!
I will also put you in touch with Kaitlin so she can explain the tasks she does (Zoom stuff, scheduling, training evaluations, etc.). 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need anything else in the meantime.
Thanks so much! 
Nicole

subject: Aflac ACH Payment Notification
body:
Please review the attachment for detailed payment information.
**********REMINDER******** 
How to Submit Invoices 
Invoices should be submitted only after you've provided goods or services to Aflac via email as an attachment to 
APInvoices@aflac.com
 
(This email address is for invoice submission only). 
Please be sure to: 
Attach a copy of your invoice to the email. PDF is the preferred invoice format.
Submit only one invoice per email. Emails containing multiple invoices will be returned for re-submission as single requests.
Email your invoice to 
APInvoices@aflac.com
 
(This email address is for invoice submission only)
.
**If you were issued a 10-digit Aflac Purchase Order Number, be sure to include it on each invoice you submit. Failure to do so will result in a returned invoice. As a reminder, Aflac Purchase Order Numbers are numeric-only and begin with 45. 
Please note if you are enrolled in the Ariba network, invoices must be submitted via the Ariba network. 
Thank you for doing business with Aflac!
Aflac Accounts Payable Department
 
Confidentiality Notice: 
This e-mail and any attachments may contain confidential information intended solely for the use of the addressee. If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, any distribution, copying, or use of this e-mail or its attachments is prohibited. If you received this message in error, please notify the sender immediately by e-mail and delete this message and any copies. Thank you.

subject: RE: help responding to BSC re: change in invoicing method
body:
I’m not a good one to ask on how to word it, but for our understanding internally – invoicing this way is more in line with the way the SOW was actually prepaid – spread out over all of the deliverables. We took the entire SOW and charged half the total amount, rather than, say, charging for the full amount of half of the deliverables (which is in line with how we used to invoice).
 
All that said, if she keeps pushing back and it’s ok with you, we can go back to the previous method, it’s just a bit more work on my end.
 
SG
 
From:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, April 3, 2025 09:40
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 help responding to BSC re: change in invoicing method
 
Hi, could one of you please help me articulate a response to Shani? 
 
Before sending the invoice to them SG had explained to me that since they prepaid half of the SOW, we’d now be sending invoices after the sessions are delivered for half of the total amount (rather than using up the prepayment and then sending full invoices) to spread out the cash flow over the delivery. 
 
How can I respond to her question below in a client-centered way, especially since we’re suddenly changing our invoicing process on them?
 
 
Thanks, both!
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her)

LCW

, would you be able to clarify why we are moving away from the practice of charging sessions to the Prepay until we reach the total amount of the prepay with sessions held?
 
That is the approach we used last year. 
 
For example, we prepaid $90,779  in Feb 2024 and all sessions up until June/Sep 2024 were covered in the prepay, then we started paying for the rest of sessions after that.

subject: RE: Onboarding info - LCW
body:
Hi Sarah, welcome to the team!
 
Attached is the time sheet for this quarter (I’ll send out a new one to all hourly folks at the end of June). You will fill this out and submit twice a month to Nicole for approval, after the 15
th
 and the last of the month. Payment is processed at the end of the following period – so for this period April 1
st
 to 15
th
, you’ll be paid on May 1
st
, as long as I got the approval in time to schedule it on the run.
 
We make contractor payments using QuickBooks Online ACH. I just sent you an invitation email to create an account and manage your own bank information, which can also be used to access your Form 1099 at year end. If you didn’t get that email, you can click this link:
 
https://signup.quickbooks.intuit.com/index.html?locale=en-US&offerId=20026530&offerType=trial&product=qbmoney&username=sej93%40outlook.com&flowId=us-qbmoney-b2b-trial&payeeId=262c19fc-739c-4396-883b-06c7261d2521&senderCompanyName=Language+%26+Culture+Worldwide%2C+LLC
 
Please let me know if you run into any issues – I can input your bank data manually if necessary. And feel free to reach out with questions at any time! I will be on vacation the 9
th
 through 24
th
, but still checking email occasionally if you need something.
 
Best,
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW
Email: 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 
I will be traveling April 9
th
 through 25
th
 with limited access to email.

 <

Hi again Sarah,
 
I'm copying our bookkeeper, SG, who will send you instructions for invoicing (via a timesheet). SG will get you all set up for payments.
 
@Accounting
 - Sarah's rate is $30/hr. LMK if you need more info. (I'm awaiting her W9).
 
Thank you!
 
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Wednesday, April 2, 2025 9:18 AM
To:
 
sj93@outlook.com
 <
sj93@outlook.com
>
Subject:
 Onboarding info - LCW
 
 
Good morning, Sarah,
 
I'm super excited to have you start! Here's a long email with lots of info! 
🙂
 
To get you set up, attached please find our 
Contactor Agreement 
for your signature. You just need to add your address under 9.g & fill in the "Contractor" box on the last page. You can sign electronically. LMK if you have any issues with the form.
 
I've also attached a 
W9
 form for you to send in case you don't have one already. Please send this back.
 
And I attached the
 job description
 again just to have everything in one place 
🙂
.
 
Please send your 
resume
 when you get a moment.
 
I got your 
LCW email
 set up. See attached image. Email is: 
s.jordan@lcwmail.com
. Your current PW is Password: H&420715447080ud . When you log in, it will ask you to reset your password. 
Up to you, but I use office 365 online (instead of downloading the app). You can use either. LMK if you have any issues getting in.
 
Lastly, I will need your banking information. I will send a separate email about that & will introduce you to our bookkeeper, Sarah (they/them) - who we call SG 
🙂
. We will give you instructions on how to fill out your timesheet for payment (which is every 2 weeks).
 
One more thing...
I'd love to chat again to explain a bunch of things about LCW
 & how we work, etc.
I have time tomorrow (Thurs) at 9am or at 4pm. Or I can do Mon from 2pm onward. LMK what works for you!
I will also put you in touch with Kaitlin so she can explain the tasks she does (Zoom stuff, scheduling, training evaluations, etc.). 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need anything else in the meantime.
Thanks so much! 
Nicole

subject: Re: Weekly accounting update 4/2/25
body:
Thanks so much SG. I'll take September! Hoping some of those pending SOWs get signed soon & some new biz comes in. Appreciate it. And noted on your vacay. Sounds like a plan!
From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Wednesday, April 2, 2025 4:47 PM
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Weekly accounting update 4/2/25
 
 
Hi Team, attached are this week’s reports. 
 
I accounted for all of the prepaid expenses we put through recently, and updated projected invoicing from Scoro with SOW’s that are signed or in progress. 
SOW’s that aren’t signed yet (and deliverables on active SOW’s that aren’t scheduled yet) are NOT reflected so 
those will be additional revenue
.
 
Without additional revenue we will start operating at a loss in June, and the line of concern is in the middle of September. I expect this line to keep getting pushed as time goes on and more invoicing gets planned, barring major expenses that I don’t know about.
 
Regarding my upcoming vacation:
 
I leave next Wednesday the 9
th

subject: Weekly accounting update 4/2/25
body:
Hi Team, attached are this week’s reports. 
 
I accounted for all of the prepaid expenses we put through recently, and updated projected invoicing from Scoro with SOW’s that are signed or in progress. 
SOW’s that aren’t signed yet (and deliverables on active SOW’s that aren’t scheduled yet) are NOT reflected so 
those will be additional revenue
.
 
Without additional revenue we will start operating at a loss in June, and the line of concern is in the middle of September. I expect this line to keep getting pushed as time goes on and more invoicing gets planned, barring major expenses that I don’t know about.
 
Regarding my upcoming vacation:
 
I leave next Wednesday the 9
th
, and I’ll be here briefly in the morning and then offline for the rest of the week. 
My plan is to schedule the PPF before I leave, to run automatically on the 14
th
. 
I will try to check my email and Teams every couple of days, and stay on top of new invoicing and any urgent questions/requests. I’ll also try to do a forecast update for you sometime around the 16
th
-18th, I think we’ll have a chill day or two in there. I will not be available for any meetings.
I’ll be back home and working on Monday the 28
th

Hope the rest of the week goes great!

subject: RE: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
body:
Yes, we have 30-day terms for external contractors. It’s sometimes a day or two past 30 just due to run timing, but on paper it’s 30.
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 5:33 PM
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
Thanks SG!
We pay translators within 30 days, correct?
 
 
From:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 6:01 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
So the way we currently pay vendors, in order of preference, is:
 
ACH to a US bank account
PayPal
(international wire, but the service we use is currently unavailable due to their vendor issues – I am looking into other options)
 
We don’t send physical checks anymore, it’s electronic only. For US bank accounts, I need the vendor to provide an email address, and then I will send them an invite to create a QuickBooks Money account to manage their information (or send me routing & account). PayPal they just need to give me the email.
 
Hope this is helpful, let me know if you need anything else 
😊
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Monday, March 31, 2025 16:01
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
HI again SG. I also found this old form (attached) that it seems we used to send to translators to get their banking info / payment preferences. Again, no rush, but can you also check if the attached is needed? Or maybe parts are needed or things need to be updated?
 
Thanks again!
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Monday, March 31, 2025 12:15 PM
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
Hi SG.
 
No rush on this.... When you get a sec, can you please lmk if the below is still appropriate? I'm updating our Translation Agreement & think the below might be out of date. Thank you!
 
6.5.  LCW shall pay the Translator with a check drawn on a US bank (or with PayPal, if so requested by the translator) in US dollars (US$), within 30 days of receiving the invoice, unless agreed upon otherwise by both LCW and the Translator. All bank and processing fees for receiving the money are the responsibility of the translator.
 
6.6.  The Translator 
may 
request payment via electronic funds transfer (wire transfer). In cases where the invoice amount exceeds US$1000.00, LCW will pay the outgoing wire transfer fees. For lesser amounts, the wire transfer may be requested by discounting the invoice by US$35.00 for international transfers and US$25 for domestic (US) transfers (the charge LCW incurs by initiating the wire transfer).
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: Re: Onboarding info - LCW
body:
Hi again Sarah,
I'm copying our bookkeeper, SG, who will send you instructions for invoicing (via a timesheet). SG will get you all set up for payments.
@Accounting
 - Sarah's rate is $30/hr. LMK if you need more info. (I'm awaiting her W9).
Thank you!
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Wednesday, April 2, 2025 9:18 AM
To:
 sj93@outlook.com <sj93@outlook.com>
Subject:
 Onboarding info - LCW
 
 
Good morning, Sarah,
I'm super excited to have you start! Here's a long email with lots of info! 🙂
To get you set up, attached please find our 
Contactor Agreement 
for your signature. You just need to add your address under 9.g & fill in the "Contractor" box on the last page. You can sign electronically. LMK if you have any issues with the form.
I've also attached a 
W9
 form for you to send in case you don't have one already. Please send this back.
And I attached the
 job description
 again just to have everything in one place 🙂.
Please send your 
resume
 when you get a moment.
I got your 
LCW email
 set up. See attached image. Email is: s.jordan@lcwmail.com. Your current PW is Password: H&420715447080ud . When you log in, it will ask you to reset your password. 
Up to you, but I use office 365 online (instead of downloading the app). You can use either. LMK if you have any issues getting in.
Lastly, I will need your banking information. I will send a separate email about that & will introduce you to our bookkeeper, Sarah (they/them) - who we call SG 🙂. We will give you instructions on how to fill out your timesheet for payment (which is every 2 weeks).
One more thing...
I'd love to chat again to explain a bunch of things about LCW
 & how we work, etc.
I have time tomorrow (Thurs) at 9am or at 4pm. Or I can do Mon from 2pm onward. LMK what works for you!
I will also put you in touch with Kaitlin so she can explain the tasks she does (Zoom stuff, scheduling, training evaluations, etc.). 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need anything else in the meantime.
Thanks so much! 
Nicole
Nicole Barile

subject: Notice of Time to File UI Quarterly Tax and Wage Reports
body:
Your Wisconsin Quarterly Unemployment Insurance Tax and Wage Reports and payment for first quarter 2025 are due on April 30, 2025. You can now login to your UI account at 
http://dwd.wisconsin.gov/ui
 and file the reports for first quarter 2025. If you've already filed the reports for first quarter 2025, no further action is required. 
You received this email because a user created Login ID subscribed to receive quarterly Time to File email reminders at this email address. This Time to File email reminder was not sent in reference to a specific Wisconsin Unemployment Insurance Account. 
If you no longer wish to receive this email, login to your account and update your email subscriptions. Email subscriptions are located in the "Other Functions" section of the Unemployment Insurance Online Services web site.
Please do not reply to this email. Questions or comments may be sent to 
taxnet@dwd.wisconsin.gov

subject: Re: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
body:
Thanks SG!
We pay translators within 30 days, correct?
From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 6:01 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
So the way we currently pay vendors, in order of preference, is:
 
ACH to a US bank account
PayPal
(international wire, but the service we use is currently unavailable due to their vendor issues – I am looking into other options)
 
We don’t send physical checks anymore, it’s electronic only. For US bank accounts, I need the vendor to provide an email address, and then I will send them an invite to create a QuickBooks Money account to manage their information (or send me routing & account). PayPal they just need to give me the email.
 
Hope this is helpful, let me know if you need anything else 
😊
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, March 31, 2025 16:01
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
HI again SG. I also found this old form (attached) that it seems we used to send to translators to get their banking info / payment preferences. Again, no rush, but can you also check if the attached is needed? Or maybe parts are needed or things need to be updated?
 
Thanks again!
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Monday, March 31, 2025 12:15 PM
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Cecilia Mariotta <
c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
 
Hi SG.
 
No rush on this.... When you get a sec, can you please lmk if the below is still appropriate? I'm updating our Translation Agreement & think the below might be out of date. Thank you!
 
6.5.  LCW shall pay the Translator with a check drawn on a US bank (or with PayPal, if so requested by the translator) in US dollars (US$), within 30 days of receiving the invoice, unless agreed upon otherwise by both LCW and the Translator. All bank and processing fees for receiving the money are the responsibility of the translator.
 
6.6.  The Translator 
may 
request payment via electronic funds transfer (wire transfer). In cases where the invoice amount exceeds US$1000.00, LCW will pay the outgoing wire transfer fees. For lesser amounts, the wire transfer may be requested by discounting the invoice by US$35.00 for international transfers and US$25 for domestic (US) transfers (the charge LCW incurs by initiating the wire transfer).
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

body:
Hi Jessica,
 
Before I fill out the form, can you let me know if the attached direct deposit form is sufficient for supporting documentation, or do I need a check? We do not have checks for this account so I will need to figure out what else we could provide, or have our leadership order them.
 
Thanks,
SG
 
From:
 Hernandez, Jessica <Jessica.Hernandez@lendlease.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 12:58
To:
 Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com>; Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>; Rzeszewicz, Linda <Linda.Rzeszewicz@lendlease.com>
Subject:
 Request to update ACH instructions for Language & Culture Worldwide LLC (#95173)
Importance:
 High
 
New Procedure for Updating ACH instructions – Effective February 13, 2025.
 
Dear Accounting Team at LCW   ,
 
In addition to having the form filled out with it’s accompaning supporting documenation (IE a voided check).  Lendlease has implemented a new procedure for updating ACH instructions and creating new ACH accounts.
 
To ensure compliance, please follow these steps.
 
The Master Data Manager will contact the authorized user of the bank account to verify account details.  The process will include:  
Confirming that the individual on the call is an authorized user of the establshiment’s bank account.
Validating the banking instructions associated with the account.
Ensuring the account is current and complete.
 
 
To proceed, please call 704-357-6551, you may set up a time and date first, with me through email, if you’d prefer.
 
Best Regards,
 
 
Jessica M. Hernández
 
She/Her/Hers
Manager of Master Data, MDM Group for the Americas/ ERN
2320 Cascade Pointe Boulevard, Suite 300, Charlotte, NC 28208
T 704-357-6551 | M 980-433-7903 | F  704-357-2854

Subject:
 BSC prepayments
 
 
Hi Chuck and Nicole,
 
I ran a big reconciliation on BSC prepayments yesterday, and the great news is we only have $2,500 of their prepayment on file in Scoro that I think shouldn’t be there – it seems to be from an SOW that spanned the “gap” of when ownership changed in 2022, so I don’t have good records. Every prepaid SOW since then has used its entire prepayment, so all we’re left with is the $67,000 on 2024-369 which is in progress.
 
With your permission, I’ll write off the $2500 in Scoro.
 
Thx,
 
“SG” Gluckstein

BSC does not owe us any more money on this SOW, we have it in hand. My questions are just for internal record-keeping and recognizing when we are done with the SOW. I’m not sure why it’s marked as complete, but that can be changed.
 
I hope that makes sense – let me know.
 
SG

To that end, I’ve updated all the ‘delivery dates’ in the Compass Quote pertaining to the items in this invoice. RP – the draft invoice attached was converted to a prepayment invoice 95044 and paid, so we have the money on hand, it’s just a matter of marking it as “used” on our end (we like this to kind of match up with the delivery dates, so we recognize the payment around the time we did the work). That’s why the dots are still gray in Compass, the money is just waiting to be applied.
 
BSC does not owe us any more money on this SOW, we have it in hand. My questions are just for internal record-keeping and recognizing when we are done with the SOW. I’m not sure why it’s marked as complete, but that can be changed.
 
I hope that makes sense – let me know.
 
SG

subject: Request to update ACH instructions for Language & Culture Worldwide LLC (#95173)
body:
New Procedure for Updating ACH instructions – Effective February 13, 2025.
 
Dear Accounting Team at LCW   ,
 
In addition to having the form filled out with it’s accompaning supporting documenation (IE a voided check).  Lendlease has implemented a new procedure for updating ACH instructions and creating new ACH accounts.
 
To ensure compliance, please follow these steps.
 
The Master Data Manager will contact the authorized user of the bank account to verify account details.  The process will include:  
Confirming that the individual on the call is an authorized user of the establshiment’s bank account.
Validating the banking instructions associated with the account.
Ensuring the account is current and complete.
 
 
To proceed, please call 704-357-6551, you may set up a time and date first, with me through email, if you’d prefer.
 
Best Regards,
 
 
Jessica M. Hernández
 
She/Her/Hers
Manager of Master Data, MDM Group for the Americas/ ERN
2320 Cascade Pointe Boulevard, Suite 300, Charlotte, NC 28208
T 704-357-6551 | M 980-433-7903 | F  704-357-2854

body:
Hi SG. Yes, please proceed.
Thank you!
From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 1, 2025 11:47 AM
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 BSC prepayments
 
 
Hi Chuck and Nicole,
 
I ran a big reconciliation on BSC prepayments yesterday, and the great news is we only have $2,500 of their prepayment on file in Scoro that I think shouldn’t be there – it seems to be from an SOW that spanned the “gap” of when ownership changed in 2022, so I don’t have good records. Every prepaid SOW since then has used its entire prepayment, so all we’re left with is the $67,000 on 2024-369 which is in progress.
 
With your permission, I’ll write off the $2500 in Scoro.
 
Thx,
 
“SG” Gluckstein

Hi RP, thanks for all the details!
 
For BSC, yes it is SOW 2024369. Since they prepaid half, what I will do is send invoices after the sessions are delivered for half of the total amount, rather than using up the prepayment and then sending full invoices – spread out the cash flow over the delivery. Does that make sense? If they push back we can change that process but it’s better for us to be sending milestone invoices along the way.
 
I can send Shani a draft invoice for the 3/10 EMEA session (for $4,500) for approval, and then do the same at the end of next month for the next session. Let me know if that sounds good.
 
Colgate: the item on my list is actually SOW 2025107, which is in sig pending status. Please let me know any updates on that.
 
(Colgate 2024175 is fully billed until their subscription charges come up again.)
 
Thank you!!
SG

Subject:
 Please send in Scoro invoices
 
Hey team,
 
SG is expecting these invoices this week:
 
Ubisoft $1,600
BSC $18,000
I assume this is pertaining to SOW 2024-369?
"Leading Inclusively in the US" sessions prev scheduled for Feb 26, Mar 25, and Apr 29 (at $9k each) were postponed. I’ve noted it in Compass, and have indicated arbitrary Sept dates as placeholders.
 
"Leading Inclusively in EMEA":
March 10 at 6am ET (for Global Emerging Markets) 
9k 
– this one did take place
 
An invoice for 50% of this SOW ($71.5k) was sent to BSC in early Feb, so even if all 4 sessions had transpired, their prepayment would have covered it, no? I’m sure I’m missing some process though, and I appreciate if that was explained to me. 
 
 
Gap $5,005
 
Colgate $25,000
Colgate was reassigned to me recently. I assume this $25k is associated with SOW 2024-175?
I see that $110,500 of this SOW has been invoiced and collected, and it would be super helpful if you indicated which line items in the SOW require invoicing?
 
 
I also see in Scoro that perhaps we should also be billing for Debevoise & Lendlease....?
 
If something has changed, please notify her. If not, please make sure the invoice is created in Scoro & marked as "Ready to Invoice" asap.
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile

6.5.  LCW shall pay the Translator with a check drawn on a US bank (or with PayPal, if so requested by the translator) in US dollars (US$), within 30 days of receiving the invoice, unless agreed upon otherwise by both LCW and the Translator. All bank and processing fees for receiving the money are the responsibility of the translator.
 
6.6.  The Translator 
may 
request payment via electronic funds transfer (wire transfer). In cases where the invoice amount exceeds US$1000.00, LCW will pay the outgoing wire transfer fees. For lesser amounts, the wire transfer may be requested by discounting the invoice by US$35.00 for international transfers and US$25 for domestic (US) transfers (the charge LCW incurs by initiating the wire transfer).

subject: Canc + Post questions
body:
Hiya!
What should happen if...
a) a company prepaid for an SOW 
in full
 and they then have a cancelation or postponement fee?
B) a company prepaid for 
part of 
an SOW and then they have a cancelation or postponement fee?
The consultant can add the cancelation/postponement charge in Scoro as a new charge. 
My question is... Would you invoice the client for that new charge, or would you simply deduct it from their prepayment (apply it to their prepayment)?
Does that make sense. LMK if it would be easier to chat about it. This was a question the consultants had, and it would be great to get your input.
Thanks!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: Invoicing language in Translator Agreement
body:
Hi SG.
No rush on this.... When you get a sec, can you please lmk if the below is still appropriate? I'm updating our Translation Agreement & think the below might be out of date. Thank you!
6.5.  LCW shall pay the Translator with a check drawn on a US bank (or with PayPal, if so requested by the translator) in US dollars (US$), within 30 days of receiving the invoice, unless agreed upon otherwise by both LCW and the Translator. All bank and processing fees for receiving the money are the responsibility of the translator.
 
6.6.  The Translator 
may 
request payment via electronic funds transfer (wire transfer). In cases where the invoice amount exceeds US$1000.00, LCW will pay the outgoing wire transfer fees. For lesser amounts, the wire transfer may be requested by discounting the invoice by US$35.00 for international transfers and US$25 for domestic (US) transfers (the charge LCW incurs by initiating the wire transfer).
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

Hi RP, thanks for all the details!
 
For BSC, yes it is SOW 2024369. Since they prepaid half, what I will do is send invoices after the sessions are delivered for half of the total amount, rather than using up the prepayment and then sending full invoices – spread out the cash flow over the delivery. Does that make sense? If they push back we can change that process but it’s better for us to be sending milestone invoices along the way.
 
I can send Shani a draft invoice for the 3/10 EMEA session (for $4,500) for approval, and then do the same at the end of next month for the next session. Let me know if that sounds good.
 
Colgate: the item on my list is actually SOW 2025107, which is in sig pending status. Please let me know any updates on that.
 
(Colgate 2024175 is fully billed until their subscription charges come up again.)
 
Thank you!!
SG

Hey team,
 
SG is expecting these invoices this week:
 
Ubisoft $1,600
BSC $18,000
I assume this is pertaining to SOW 2024-369?
"Leading Inclusively in the US" sessions prev scheduled for Feb 26, Mar 25, and Apr 29 (at $9k each) were postponed. I’ve noted it in Compass, and have indicated arbitrary Sept dates as placeholders.
 
"Leading Inclusively in EMEA":
March 10 at 6am ET (for Global Emerging Markets) 
9k 
– this one did take place
 
An invoice for 50% of this SOW ($71.5k) was sent to BSC in early Feb, so even if all 4 sessions had transpired, their prepayment would have covered it, no? I’m sure I’m missing some process though, and I appreciate if that was explained to me. 
 
 
Gap $5,005
 
Colgate $25,000
Colgate was reassigned to me recently. I assume this $25k is associated with SOW 2024-175?
I see that $110,500 of this SOW has been invoiced and collected, and it would be super helpful if you indicated which line items in the SOW require invoicing?
 
 
I also see in Scoro that perhaps we should also be billing for Debevoise & Lendlease....?
 
If something has changed, please notify her. If not, please make sure the invoice is created in Scoro & marked as "Ready to Invoice" asap.
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile

Also – and separately - BSC’s SOW 2023-317 is marked “completed”, but we have not delivered 24 of the sessions from this SOW:
“Understanding Your Cultural Lens” (listed in the SOW as “Collaborating Across Cultures”) – 5 sessions for APAC, 5 for LatAm, and 2 for Canada – 
1 session for APAC and 1 for Canada have been scheduled
“Leading Inclusively” (listed in the SOW as “Developing Inclusively-Black Talent” – 5 sessions for APAC, 5 for LatAm, and 2 for Canada - 
1 session for APAC and 1 for Canada have been scheduled
 
Has SOW 2023-313 been fully invoiced?
 
ColPal: 
SOW 2025-107 is for a total of $40k. I resent them the SOW yesterday because they finally said they’re ready to proceed. I sent it for 100% up front. Haven’t received the signed SOW yet.
 
Thank you!
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
LCW
 
 
From:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 25, 2025 11:24 AM

 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: BSC & Colgate
 
Hi RP, thanks for all the details!
 
For BSC, yes it is SOW 2024369. Since they prepaid half, what I will do is send invoices after the sessions are delivered for half of the total amount, rather than using up the prepayment and then sending full invoices – spread out the cash flow over the delivery. Does that make sense? If they push back we can change that process but it’s better for us to be sending milestone invoices along the way.
 
I can send Shani a draft invoice for the 3/10 EMEA session (for $4,500) for approval, and then do the same at the end of next month for the next session. Let me know if that sounds good.
 
Colgate: the item on my list is actually SOW 2025107, which is in sig pending status. Please let me know any updates on that.
 
(Colgate 2024175 is fully billed until their subscription charges come up again.)
 
Thank you!!
SG

Subject:

Hey team,
 
SG is expecting these invoices this week:
 
Ubisoft $1,600
BSC $18,000
I assume this is pertaining to SOW 2024-369?
"Leading Inclusively in the US" sessions prev scheduled for Feb 26, Mar 25, and Apr 29 (at $9k each) were postponed. I’ve noted it in Compass, and have indicated arbitrary Sept dates as placeholders.
 
"Leading Inclusively in EMEA":
March 10 at 6am ET (for Global Emerging Markets) 
9k 
– this one did take place
 
An invoice for 50% of this SOW ($71.5k) was sent to BSC in early Feb, so even if all 4 sessions had transpired, their prepayment would have covered it, no? I’m sure I’m missing some process though, and I appreciate if that was explained to me. 
 
 
Gap $5,005
 
Colgate $25,000
Colgate was reassigned to me recently. I assume this $25k is associated with SOW 2024-175?
I see that $110,500 of this SOW has been invoiced and collected, and it would be super helpful if you indicated which line items in the SOW require invoicing?
 
 
I also see in Scoro that perhaps we should also be billing for Debevoise & Lendlease....?
 
If something has changed, please notify her. If not, please make sure the invoice is created in Scoro & marked as "Ready to Invoice" asap.
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile

Subject:
 Language & Culture Worldwide: Payroll->I received a tax notice: Support Case # 04019085
 
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
 
Thank you for reaching out to TriNet Customer Support, my name is Alvin
 
I understand you have questions if Trinet will file quarterly wage and unemployment tax returns for the following States IL, NJ, NC and OH. I am glad to assist you with your inquiry.
 
Checking on your Level of Service for these states, they are currently in Full Service since April 1st, 2022. Trinet will continue to file the quarterly wage and unemployment tax returns for the state mentioned above.
 
However, you may also need to file local taxes wherein the Local agencies in Ohio are still in Calculate only.
 
Checking on your Payroll tax settings the following local agencies are not yet in full service.
 
 
 
You can contact the local agencies to get a tax account number to move these local agencies to full service if needed.
 
How do I move to Full Service 
 
I hope this information helps.
 
If you have further questions, please feel free to reach out. If no further reply or inquiry is received, I will assume that no further help is needed and will close this ticket within 3 business days.
 
 
You can find answers to most questions at 
Trinet Help Center
 but feel free to reach back out to support if you need anything else!
 
 
All the best,
 
 
Alvin D.
Customer Support Services Specialist - Time and Pay | Trinet HR Platform | 
www.trinet.com

Trinet HR Platform Help Center

Another FYI 
🙂
 
I like to keep people in the loop as you can see lol!
From:
 Zenefits Support <
support@zenefits.com
>
Sent:
 Thursday, March 27, 2025 6:10 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Language & Culture Worldwide: Payroll->I received a tax notice: Support Case # 04019085
 
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
 
Thank you for reaching out to TriNet Customer Support, my name is Alvin
 
I understand you have questions if Trinet will file quarterly wage and unemployment tax returns for the following States IL, NJ, NC and OH. I am glad to assist you with your inquiry.
 
Checking on your Level of Service for these states, they are currently in Full Service since April 1st, 2022. Trinet will continue to file the quarterly wage and unemployment tax returns for the state mentioned above.
 
However, you may also need to file local taxes wherein the Local agencies in Ohio are still in Calculate only.
 
Checking on your Payroll tax settings the following local agencies are not yet in full service.
 
 
 
You can contact the local agencies to get a tax account number to move these local agencies to full service if needed.
 
How do I move to Full Service 
 
I hope this information helps.
 
If you have further questions, please feel free to reach out. If no further reply or inquiry is received, I will assume that no further help is needed and will close this ticket within 3 business days.
 
 
You can find answers to most questions at 
Trinet Help Center
 but feel free to reach back out to support if you need anything else!
 
 
All the best,
 
 
Alvin D.
Customer Support Services Specialist - Time and Pay | Trinet HR Platform | 
www.trinet.com
Have questions? Get answers at 
Trinet HR Platform Help Center

subject: Account Password Changed
body:
Hello, 
The 
password
 for the UI account akolodiz00 was just 
changed
. 
If you recently reset your Unemployment Insurance Tax and Claims password, then you can safely ignore this email. 
If this was not expected, your account may have been compromised. Please follow the step below: 
Reset your 
password
. 
Please protect your account 
password
. Here are a couple of tips to protect your unemployment insurance account. 
Never respond to the email if you are not sure about the sender. 
Never give your account 
password
 to anyone. We will never ask for personal information(Social Security Number, username or 
password
) by email. 
This is an automated notification from the New Mexico Department of Workforce Solutions. If you didn't initiate this request, immediately call 1-877-NM4-MYUI 
(1-877-664-6984
) Monday through Friday from 
8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
 for assistance. 
Please do not reply to this message. Replies to this message are routed to an unmonitored mailbox. If you have questions, you can contact a Customer Service Agent in the Unemployment Insurance Operations Center at 
1-877-664-6984
, Monday through Friday from 
8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
 If you are an individual filing or certifying for benefits, you can also log into your Unemployment Insurance account at 
www.jobs.state.nm.us
 If you are an employer, you can login to your employer account at 
www.dws.state.nm.us
 
Learn about e-mail security or report suspicious e-mail at 
www.dws.state.nm.us
.
Terms of Use 
New Mexico Department of Workforce Solutions   
401 Broadway NE   
Albuquerque NM 87102 
© 2012 New Mexico Department of Workforce Solutions. All rights reserved.

 Tuesday, March 25, 2025 14:07

 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>; Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Shreya Kanungo <
skanungo@rippling.com
>
Subject:
 Complete Employee/Contractor Upload
 
Hi Nicole and Sarah,
In order to finish the employee/contractor import and send invites, please go to the Company Settings > 
Data Import
 page and under each category/section (Active Employees, Active Contractors, etc.) click View details > In progress > Resume > Take me to where I left off.
It looks like you've already uploaded your 5 active employees, but there are 49 pending terminated employees. Please Note: you only need to upload the terminated employees that were paid this calendar year. For any terminated employees you do not wish to import over, please uncheck them on the far left.
On the next page which shows the table with employee details, scroll to the right to fill in any missing details. Pay attention to the columns with red asterisks (
*
) as these indicate which fields are required. In addition to the required fields, please select a department for each employee/contractor (view departments 
here
). Once all required information for each employee has been entered, click Continue at the bottom-right. Once the import is complete you'll be able to send invites on the 
Data Import
 page.
Hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.
 
--
Tyler Stetson
Implementation Manager | 
Rippling.com

Mon 4/21
 
Fri 4/24 – Mon 4/28
 
Wed 5/14 – Mon 5/19

). Once all required information for each employee has been entered, click Continue at the bottom-right. Once the import is complete you'll be able to send invites on the 
Data Import
 page.
Hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.
--
Tyler Stetson
Implementation Manager | 
Rippling.com

body:
p.s., Nicole re: your note about including external consultant COGS, I will enter Yuko D. (Japan) and Jas K. (Canada) for APAC and Canada scheduled sessions pertaining to 2023-317.  Also, I had a typo below in my original email – should be 317, not 313!
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
LCW
 
 
From:
 Rebecca Parrilla 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 25, 2025 1:06 PM
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: BSC & Colgate
 
BSC:
 Your proposal for the March 10
th
 EMEA session sounds good. Would you mind sending me that DRAFT invoice so I can run it by them? 
 
Also – and separately - BSC’s SOW 2023-317 is marked “completed”, but we have not delivered 24 of the sessions from this SOW:
“Understanding Your Cultural Lens” (listed in the SOW as “Collaborating Across Cultures”) – 5 sessions for APAC, 5 for LatAm, and 2 for Canada – 
1 session for APAC and 1 for Canada have been scheduled
“Leading Inclusively” (listed in the SOW as “Developing Inclusively-Black Talent” – 5 sessions for APAC, 5 for LatAm, and 2 for Canada - 
1 session for APAC and 1 for Canada have been scheduled
 
Has SOW 2023-
317
 been fully invoiced?
 
ColPal: 
SOW 2025-107 is for a total of $40k. I resent them the SOW yesterday because they finally said they’re ready to proceed. I sent it for 100% up front. Haven’t received the signed SOW yet.
 
Thank you!
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
LCW
 
 
From:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 25, 2025 11:24 AM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: BSC & Colgate
 
Hi RP, thanks for all the details!
 
For BSC, yes it is SOW 2024369. Since they prepaid half, what I will do is send invoices after the sessions are delivered for half of the total amount, rather than using up the prepayment and then sending full invoices – spread out the cash flow over the delivery. Does that make sense? If they push back we can change that process but it’s better for us to be sending milestone invoices along the way.
 
I can send Shani a draft invoice for the 3/10 EMEA session (for $4,500) for approval, and then do the same at the end of next month for the next session. Let me know if that sounds good.
 
Colgate: the item on my list is actually SOW 2025107, which is in sig pending status. Please let me know any updates on that.
 
(Colgate 2024175 is fully billed until their subscription charges come up again.)
 
Thank you!!
SG

>; Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>

 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Please send in Scoro invoices
 
Hey team,
 
SG is expecting these invoices this week:
 
Ubisoft $1,600
BSC $18,000
I assume this is pertaining to SOW 2024-369?
"Leading Inclusively in the US" sessions prev scheduled for Feb 26, Mar 25, and Apr 29 (at $9k each) were postponed. I’ve noted it in Compass, and have indicated arbitrary Sept dates as placeholders.
 
"Leading Inclusively in EMEA":
March 10 at 6am ET (for Global Emerging Markets) 
9k 
– this one did take place
 
An invoice for 50% of this SOW ($71.5k) was sent to BSC in early Feb, so even if all 4 sessions had transpired, their prepayment would have covered it, no? I’m sure I’m missing some process though, and I appreciate if that was explained to me. 
 
 
Gap $5,005
 
Colgate $25,000
Colgate was reassigned to me recently. I assume this $25k is associated with SOW 2024-175?
I see that $110,500 of this SOW has been invoiced and collected, and it would be super helpful if you indicated which line items in the SOW require invoicing?
 
 
I also see in Scoro that perhaps we should also be billing for Debevoise & Lendlease....?
 
If something has changed, please notify her. If not, please make sure the invoice is created in Scoro & marked as "Ready to Invoice" asap.
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: RE: BSC & Colgate
body:
Hi RP, thanks for all the details!
 
For BSC, yes it is SOW 2024369. Since they prepaid half, what I will do is send invoices after the sessions are delivered for half of the total amount, rather than using up the prepayment and then sending full invoices – spread out the cash flow over the delivery. Does that make sense? If they push back we can change that process but it’s better for us to be sending milestone invoices along the way.
 
I can send Shani a draft invoice for the 3/10 EMEA session (for $4,500) for approval, and then do the same at the end of next month for the next session. Let me know if that sounds good.
 
Colgate: the item on my list is actually SOW 2025107, which is in sig pending status. Please let me know any updates on that.
 
(Colgate 2024175 is fully billed until their subscription charges come up again.)
 
Thank you!!
SG

Subject:

Hey team,
 
SG is expecting these invoices this week:
 
Ubisoft $1,600
BSC $18,000
I assume this is pertaining to SOW 2024-369?
"Leading Inclusively in the US" sessions prev scheduled for Feb 26, Mar 25, and Apr 29 (at $9k each) were postponed. I’ve noted it in Compass, and have indicated arbitrary Sept dates as placeholders.
 
"Leading Inclusively in EMEA":
March 10 at 6am ET (for Global Emerging Markets) 
9k 
– this one did take place
 
An invoice for 50% of this SOW ($71.5k) was sent to BSC in early Feb, so even if all 4 sessions had transpired, their prepayment would have covered it, no? I’m sure I’m missing some process though, and I appreciate if that was explained to me. 
 
 
Gap $5,005
 
Colgate $25,000
Colgate was reassigned to me recently. I assume this $25k is associated with SOW 2024-175?
I see that $110,500 of this SOW has been invoiced and collected, and it would be super helpful if you indicated which line items in the SOW require invoicing?
 
 
I also see in Scoro that perhaps we should also be billing for Debevoise & Lendlease....?
 
If something has changed, please notify her. If not, please make sure the invoice is created in Scoro & marked as "Ready to Invoice" asap.
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile

Sent:
 Friday, March 21, 2025 8:26 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Rippling Implementation: Language & Culture Worldwide - Recap and next steps!
 
 
Hi Nicole and Sarah, 
It was a pleasure chatting with you two
 on our call 
today
! As promised, this recap email will outline follow-ups from our discussion today, your project plan, and the next action items for a successful implementation. 
Language & Culture Worldwide - Implementation Project Plan
 
Upcoming Calls
 
Payroll Review:
 Thursday 3/27 at 2:00pm CDT
Device Management Review:
 Wednesday 4/2 at 4:00pm EDT
Payroll Processing + Wrap-up:
 Wednesday 4/9 at 10:00am CDT
Next Action Items
 
Please complete these items prior to our next calls:
Complete 
Payroll Setup
 task in checklist - Completion Date: Wed 3/26
 
Complete 
Device Management
 task in checklist - Completion Date: Tue 4/1
 
- Complete the 
Getting Started: Device Management
 course first!
Implementation Resources
Here are a few resources that will be helpful for you during this process: 
Rippling U
 is our admin education portal, where you can find lessons and certification courses that will make you an expert Rippling user.
The 
App Shop
 is a great spot to search and learn about Third-Party App Integrations and start considering what will be advantageous to integrate with Rippling!
Our 
Help Center
 is a great first line of defense for questions. Please let me know if you're unable to find the answer to any questions there!
Lean on our 
Implementation Kickoff Deck
 to refer to our timeline and other milestones we will achieve along the way. I'm attaching it here!
Me!
 I am here to guide you throughout this process. If you cannot find an answer in the Help Center, send me a quick email or write down your question and we can cover it during one of our scheduled calls. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions on the above items.
 
I look forward to working with you!
Best,
Tyler
--
Tyler Stetson
Implementation Manager | 
Rippling.com

c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Asunto:
 RE: Translation invoice ready
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Marking it as “ready to invoice” is all I need! However, the invoice also needs to be fully filled out – Diligent has a long list of people who need to be on the email which needs to be in the invoice (see previous ones) and the “PO needed” field needs to be filled out. If I get an invoice that’s missing info, I’ll reset the status to “awaiting PO” and send an email that it needs fixing (which is this email right now). Once you add that information you can set it as “ready to invoice” again.
 
BTW, per Alisa I’m not sending new invoices right now, but anything that’s ready will wait in my to-do bucket until I get the OK to resume.
 
SG

c.mariotta@lcwmail.com
>
Asunto:
 RE: Translation invoice ready
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Marking it as “ready to invoice” is all I need! However, the invoice also needs to be fully filled out – Diligent has a long list of people who need to be on the email which needs to be in the invoice (see previous ones) and the “PO needed” field needs to be filled out. If I get an invoice that’s missing info, I’ll reset the status to “awaiting PO” and send an email that it needs fixing (which is this email right now). Once you add that information you can set it as “ready to invoice” again.
 
BTW, per Alisa I’m not sending new invoices right now, but anything that’s ready will wait in my to-do bucket until I get the OK to resume.
 
SG

From:
 Tyler Stetson <tstetson@rippling.com>
Sent:
 Friday, March 21, 2025 8:26 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Rippling Implementation: Language & Culture Worldwide - Recap and next steps!
 
 
Hi Nicole and Sarah, 
It was a pleasure chatting with you two
 on our call 
today
! As promised, this recap email will outline follow-ups from our discussion today, your project plan, and the next action items for a successful implementation. 
Language & Culture Worldwide - Implementation Project Plan
 
Upcoming Calls
 
Payroll Review:
 Thursday 3/27 at 2:00pm CDT
Device Management Review:
 Wednesday 4/2 at 4:00pm EDT
Payroll Processing + Wrap-up:
 Wednesday 4/9 at 10:00am CDT
Next Action Items
 
Please complete these items prior to our next calls:
Complete 
Payroll Setup
 task in checklist - Completion Date: Wed 3/26
 
Complete 
Device Management
 task in checklist - Completion Date: Tue 4/1
 
- Complete the 
Getting Started: Device Management
 course first!
Implementation Resources
Here are a few resources that will be helpful for you during this process: 
Rippling U
 is our admin education portal, where you can find lessons and certification courses that will make you an expert Rippling user.
The 
App Shop
 is a great spot to search and learn about Third-Party App Integrations and start considering what will be advantageous to integrate with Rippling!
Our 
Help Center
 is a great first line of defense for questions. Please let me know if you're unable to find the answer to any questions there!
Lean on our 
Implementation Kickoff Deck
 to refer to our timeline and other milestones we will achieve along the way. I'm attaching it here!
Me!
 I am here to guide you throughout this process. If you cannot find an answer in the Help Center, send me a quick email or write down your question and we can cover it during one of our scheduled calls. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions on the above items.
 
I look forward to working with you!
Best,
Tyler
--
Tyler Stetson
Implementation Manager | 
Rippling.com
 
Upcoming PTO:
 
Mon 4/21
 
Fri 4/24 – Mon 4/28
 
Wed 5/14 – Mon 5/19

We will need to add money (at least $12,000) before 4/5, when I expect the big 401k draft to go out (assuming the scheduling works the way I think it does on their end). It might be good to move that sooner in case it happens differently for the off-cycle run, and if it doesn’t hit that day I’ll keep my eyes open to be sure we have enough to cover it when it comes. CC:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Asunto:
 RE: Translation invoice ready
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Marking it as “ready to invoice” is all I need! However, the invoice also needs to be fully filled out – Diligent has a long list of people who need to be on the email which needs to be in the invoice (see previous ones) and the “PO needed” field needs to be filled out. If I get an invoice that’s missing info, I’ll reset the status to “awaiting PO” and send an email that it needs fixing (which is this email right now). Once you add that information you can set it as “ready to invoice” again.
 
BTW, per Alisa I’m not sending new invoices right now, but anything that’s ready will wait in my to-do bucket until I get the OK to resume.
 
SG

SG

subject: Re: Your Appeal
body:
Language & Culture Worldwide LLC 
To Whom It May Concern: 
Thank you for submitting your Appeal regarding Determination Letter dated 1/30/2025 which you received on 3/20/2025 . 
The reference number for your submission is: 00612920. 
Please keep this number for your records. You may need it in the future. 
You will receive an acknowledgement letter via U.S. Mail. 
If we have any questions regarding your submission, we will contact you using the contact information you have provided. 
If we are unable to accept your request as an appeal, you will receive an e-mail from us with an explanation. 
Thank you, 
The NJ Appeal Tribunal 
The Appeal Tribunal Hearing 
The information below is to help you prepare for an upcoming Appeal Tribunal hearing. Get more information on our website by 
clicking here
. 
An appeal may have been requested by you, or another interested party. An interested party is anyone who stands to gain or lose something, depending on the outcome of the appeal decision. It is in your best interest to be prepared to present your case fully at the scheduled hearing, whether or not you filed the appeal. If you or your employer files an appeal, you will get a Notice of Hearing in the mail. The notice will tell you the date and time of your hearing, and explain how to participate. Most hearings are held by phone. 
Phone Hearings:
 You will receive a Notice of Phone Hearing in the mail approximately two weeks before your scheduled hearing. The hearing notice will instruct you to call the Appeal Tribunal to register for the hearing. 
You must register in order to participate in the hearing
. Your appeal may be dismissed or you may be denied participation in the hearing if you fail to register for the hearing. It is suggested that you call the Appeal Tribunal immediately upon receipt of this notice to register. When registering you will be asked to provide your name, docket number and telephone number where you can be reached for the hearing. You will be given a confirmation number when you register. Be sure to record the confirmation number on your hearing notice. The Appeals Examiner will call you on the day of the hearing when it is time to begin the hearing. You must accept this call; we will consider it failing to participate if we cannot reach you at the number you provide. 
• Caller ID shows the telephone numbers of the Appeal Tribunal as private, unknown, out-of-area, anonymous, etc. If your phone has other features or devices to block calls, those features should be turned off on the day of your scheduled hearing. 
• If you do not call us to initiate the hearing or do not answer our call to you, your appeal may be dismissed or decided unfavorably to you. You may have to pay back any benefits you have already received. 
IMPORTANT:
 If either you or the employer is appealing a decision about your eligibility, you should continue to certify for benefits during the appeal process. If the appeal is decided in your favor, you will receive unemployment benefits only for weeks you have certified for benefits. During the appeal process you must report to any appointments for which you are scheduled. If you do not keep these appointments, you may lose benefits, even if you win your appeal. 
If your employer appeals your right to UI benefits 
If your former employer(s) disagrees with the determination awarding you benefits, the employer may appeal. If it is determined that you are eligible for benefits, you will continue to receive your benefits as long as you meet all other requirements. If the Appeal Tribunal decides in the employer’s favor, you will be required to repay all or part of the unemployment insurance benefits that have been paid to you. 
If you cannot attend a scheduled hearing 
If you are unable to participate in a scheduled hearing, you may request a postponement. The Appeal Tribunal may grant the request if you show good cause. If possible, request a postponement in advance of the hearing. 
After the hearing 
The Appeal Tribunal’s decisions are issued in writing and are based entirely on the evidence and testimony made at the hearing. If the Appeal Tribunal rules in your favor, the Division of Unemployment Insurance will issue any payments due. The Appeal Tribunal does not issue payments. Allow up to 7 days from the date of mailing for the unemployment insurance division to process the Appeal Tribunal’s decision. 
Please direct any questions about your appeal decision payment to the Reemployment Call Center. Call Centers are open weekdays (except state holidays) between 8:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m. 
North New Jersey (Union City): 201-601-4100 
Central New Jersey (Freehold): 732-761-2020 
South New Jersey (Vineland): 856-507-2340 
Out-of-State claims: 1-888-795-6672 — 
You must call from a phone with an out-of-state area code 
IMPORTANT:
 All of these phone numbers go to the same place. Local phone numbers are offered as a courtesy for callers who are charged more for long-distance calls. If you are in a phone queue, you will not move ahead by trying one of the other phone numbers. If you hang up to call a different number, you will forfeit your place and be moved to the end of the queue. 
Appeal to the Board of Review 
If you disagree with the Appeal Tribunal’s decision, you may appeal to the Board of Review. You must do this within 20 days of the mailing date of the Appeal Tribunal’s decision. Instructions on how to do this are on the last page of the Appeal Tribunal decision, which we will mail to you. 
Appeals to the Board of Review must be submitted in writing to: 
Board of Review 
New Jersey Department of Labor and Workforce Development 
P.O. Box 937 
Trenton, NJ 08625-0937 
The Board of Review is the highest appellate level within the Department of Labor and Workforce Development. The Board of Review will base its decision on a review of the Appeal Tribunal record. You can find more about the Board of Review online 
here
. 
Right to further appeal 
If you receive an unfavorable decision from the Board of Review, you may appeal the Board’s decision to the Appellate Division of the New Jersey Superior Court. The Court is part of the Judiciary branch of government and is entirely out of this department’s jurisdiction. The Court has its own rules and procedure, costs and requirements. 
For more information about appealing Board of Review decisions, call the Appellate Division at 609-815-2950 ext. 5-4720. 
You can get additional information on the appeal process, including frequently asked questions, by 
clicking here
.

subject: RE: Translation invoice ready
body:
Hi Nicole,
 
Marking it as “ready to invoice” is all I need! However, the invoice also needs to be fully filled out – Diligent has a long list of people who need to be on the email which needs to be in the invoice (see previous ones) and the “PO needed” field needs to be filled out. If I get an invoice that’s missing info, I’ll reset the status to “awaiting PO” and send an email that it needs fixing (which is this email right now). Once you add that information you can set it as “ready to invoice” again.
 
BTW, per Alisa I’m not sending new invoices right now, but anything that’s ready will wait in my to-do bucket until I get the OK to resume.
 
SG

subject: RE: Please fill out this AR Analysis
body:
Hi Alisa,
 
Attached is the completed form – I think this is what you were looking for. The book cash on the spreadsheet includes PayPal and the Chase deposit; without that (Citi and Wintrust only) it’s $89,956 at this moment.
 
Please let me know if you need anything else, I’ll be around all day.
 
SG
 
From:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 19, 2025 09:34
To:
 Sarah Gluckstein <s.gluckstein@lcwmail.com>; Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Please fill out this AR Analysis
 
 
Please fill this out. There are three tabs
Summary – this will pull AR info from AR tab and deposit info from deposit tab to show the collectability of customer AR
AR aging – import AR as of today and complete columns 
G:J
Type – should be one of below unless 
I am missing one
                  
i.
      
Finished: invoice for completed services that should be collected
                 
ii.
      
Deposit: invoice for deposit on account
               
iii.
      
Milestone: invoice for partially completed work. Also known as WIP.
Deposit on hand – this is to note whether or not this customer has a deposit on hand.
Collectible – simply note if there are any issues with the receivable. If it’s good AR, list it at 100%. If it’s disputed or prepayment, lower the collectability to 0-50%.
Deposits
 
It’d be helpful to get the below (with as much detail as possible)
AR aging
Deposit list
 
Note:
Is the AR for finished / completed work
Does the customer have any deposits on hand
 
Please layout the AR and match deposits. This is an AR analysis.
 
Thanks,
 
Alisa
 
 
Alisa Kolodizner (She/Her)
CSMO and Managing Partner, 
LCW

 [Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC] insurance broker change to Rippling
 
 
Hi, 
Thanks for signing the Broker of Record letter. Moving forward, Rippling will handle your company's insurance administrative work. You and your employees can now use Rippling to view and manage benefits. 
Here are some quick tips and highlights: 
·
        
Rippling Insurance Services, Inc (the insurance subsidiary of Rippling) will be listed as your Broker of Record with insurance carriers.
·
        
Make sure to hire and terminate employees in Rippling - that will kick off the process of adding and removing them from coverage
·
        
Your employees will need to manage their employee details and benefits in Rippling
·
        
We'll push deductions for your employees' portion of premium costs to payroll
·
        
At renewal time, your employees will be able to make annual open enrollment changes directly in Rippling
·
        
Rippling does not pay premiums on behalf of Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, you must submit payments directly to the carrier. 
Learn how
It's important to make changes to your insurance in Rippling -- not directly with the insurance carrier. By making changes directly in Rippling, we can keep your pricing and employee deductions accurate and insurance information in sync with the carrier. 
Visit our Help Center to learn more about what to expect with Rippling as your broker. Reach out if you have questions. We're looking forward to working with you! 
Thanks,
The Rippling Team

Sent:
 Tuesday, March 18, 2025 3:59 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 [Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC] insurance broker change to Rippling
 
 
Hi, 
Thanks for signing the Broker of Record letter. Moving forward, Rippling will handle your company's insurance administrative work. You and your employees can now use Rippling to view and manage benefits. 
Here are some quick tips and highlights: 
·
        
Rippling Insurance Services, Inc (the insurance subsidiary of Rippling) will be listed as your Broker of Record with insurance carriers.
·
        
Make sure to hire and terminate employees in Rippling - that will kick off the process of adding and removing them from coverage
·
        
Your employees will need to manage their employee details and benefits in Rippling
·
        
We'll push deductions for your employees' portion of premium costs to payroll
·
        
At renewal time, your employees will be able to make annual open enrollment changes directly in Rippling
·
        
Rippling does not pay premiums on behalf of Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, you must submit payments directly to the carrier. 
Learn how
It's important to make changes to your insurance in Rippling -- not directly with the insurance carrier. By making changes directly in Rippling, we can keep your pricing and employee deductions accurate and insurance information in sync with the carrier. 
Visit our Help Center to learn more about what to expect with Rippling as your broker. Reach out if you have questions. We're looking forward to working with you! 
Thanks,
The Rippling Team

I will reach out to BlueCross, but in the meantime, can you just try to pay them?
IDK if we have automatic payments set to go out to BCBS or if you manually send them each month. And I assume you pay by ACH? If so, I would just change the amounts you send to equal 2 months for both me & Chuck and see what happens. Most likely they will just have us skip 2 months in the future.
Same for Guideline 401k.
 
Is that doable? (to just pay more)?

subject: Please fill out this AR Analysis
body:
Please fill this out. There are three tabs
Summary – this will pull AR info from AR tab and deposit info from deposit tab to show the collectability of customer AR
AR aging – import AR as of today and complete columns
 
G:J
Type – should be one of below unless
 
I am missing one
                 
 
i.
     
 
Finished: invoice for completed services that should be collected
                
 
ii.
     
 
Deposit: invoice for deposit on account
              
 
iii.
     
 
Milestone: invoice for partially completed work. Also known as WIP.
Deposit on hand – this is to note whether or not this customer has a deposit on hand.
Collectible – simply note if there are any issues with the receivable. If it’s good AR, list it at 100%. If it’s disputed or prepayment, lower the collectability to 0-50%.
Deposits
 
It’d be helpful to get the below (with as much detail as possible)
AR aging
Deposit list
 
Note:
Is the AR for finished / completed work
Does the customer have any deposits on hand
 
Please layout the AR and match deposits. This is an AR analysis.
Thanks,
Alisa
 
 
Alisa Kolodizner (She/Her)
CSMO and Managing Partner,
 
LCW

subject: Fw: [Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC] insurance broker change to Rippling
body:
FYI. I have a call with Rippling this Fri & have a bunch of questions. If you have any questions for them, lmk.
From:
 Rippling <no-reply@rippling.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 18, 2025 3:59 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 [Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC] insurance broker change to Rippling
 
 
 
Hi, 
Thanks for signing the Broker of Record letter. Moving forward, Rippling will handle your company's insurance administrative work. You and your employees can now use Rippling to view and manage benefits. 
Here are some quick tips and highlights: 
Rippling Insurance Services, Inc (the insurance subsidiary of Rippling) will be listed as your Broker of Record with insurance carriers.
Make sure to hire and terminate employees in Rippling - that will kick off the process of adding and removing them from coverage
Your employees will need to manage their employee details and benefits in Rippling
We'll push deductions for your employees' portion of premium costs to payroll
At renewal time, your employees will be able to make annual open enrollment changes directly in Rippling
Rippling does not pay premiums on behalf of Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, you must submit payments directly to the carrier. 
Learn how
It's important to make changes to your insurance in Rippling -- not directly with the insurance carrier. By making changes directly in Rippling, we can keep your pricing and employee deductions accurate and insurance information in sync with the carrier. 
Visit our Help Center to learn more about what to expect with Rippling as your broker. Reach out if you have questions. We're looking forward to working with you! 
Thanks,
The Rippling Team

subject: Re: March-April payroll advance for Chuck and Nicole
body:
401k and insurances are paid directly to the vendors, so they’re not part of this payment to Zenefits. Insurance should still bill us as usual, 401k will go directly to guideline but possibly in one large payment. I’m not sure how it’s connected within Zenefits, but it’s a separate payment from us. 
Get 
Outlook for iOS

From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, March 17, 2025 3:02:16 PM
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 March-April payroll advance for Chuck and Nicole
 
 
Hi Team,
 
Confirming that I have processed a two-month salary advance for Chuck and Nicole. It will hit our Wintrust bank account in the next day or two for $39,416, and represents all pay and deductions for 3/2/25 through 5/1/25 (taxes, insurance, 401(k), etc). Chuck and Nicole will be back on the regular payroll beginning 5/2/25 and get their next check 5/15/25. For now I have removed them from regular payroll completely, and the other employees will be paid normally on the regular schedule.
 
I have a spreadsheet in Dropbox > Accounting > 0-Cash Flow Reports recording what was done.
 
Let me know with questions!
 
“SG” Gluckstein

>
Subject:
 Fwd: Invoice for February
Pls see below. Thx!
Begin forwarded message:
From:
 José Antonio Azevedo <
translator@joseazevedo.com
>
Date:
 March 13, 2025 at 9:51:53
 
PM EDT
To:
 Jorgelina Venturi <
j.venturi@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Catalina De Sanctis <
c.desanctis@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 
Re: Invoice for February
﻿
 
Hi Jorgelina and Catalina,
I hope you are well!
My invoice for February was paid today, however the amount is not correct. As you can see in the invoice attached, the amount should be 
USD144.81
 but the payment was only 
USD22.58
.
It was probably a confusion with my previous invoice, for December, that had exactly this amount (USD22.58). It seems that you paid the amount for the previous invoice, not the one that I've sent to you for February. So there's still a 
difference of USD122.23
. Could you please ask your accounting department to arrange the payment of this difference?
Thanks!
José
