subject: ONLINE REPORTING OPEN: Annual Integrated Economic Survey
body:
UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE
U.S. Census Bureau Official Correspondence
 
Annual INTEGRATED ECONOMIC Survey
Online Reporting Open
Check our email address - it's official if it ends in @notification.census.gov
 
LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
Your company has been selected to participate in the 
2024 Annual Integrated Economic Survey
.
Online reporting is 
now open
. Please use the following information to access your survey:
______________________________________________________________________________________________
Due Date: 
April 30, 2025
Register
 or 
sign in
 at 
https://portal.census.gov
Enter
 your authentication code: WU99JKC3G8WQ
 
Case-sensitive; if you copy and paste, ensure no blank spaces are captured.
Report
 by clicking on "REPORT NOW." You can return to your account over multiple sessions to complete the survey.
______________________________________________________________________________________________
YOUR RESPONSE IS REQUIRED BY LAW 
and will be kept strictly 
CONFIDENTIAL
. Information about the authority, confidentiality, and burden of this data collection can be found at the bottom of this email.
Please do not reply directly to this automated email.
 For more information or assistance completing this survey, please visit
 
https://census.gov/aies/information
 or call our customer helpline at 1-800-681-3012, Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Eastern time. For a preview of the survey questions, visit 
https://census.gov/aies/questionspreview/
.
Thank you
 in advance for your time and participation, and for helping the U.S. Census Bureau measure America's people and economy.
Sincerely,
Lisa E. Donaldson 
Chief, Economy-Wide Statistics Division 
U.S. Census Bureau
What is the Annual Integrated Economic Survey?
The 
Annual Integrated Economic Survey (AIES)
 is a re-engineered survey designed to integrate and replace seven mandatory business surveys into a streamlined single survey. The new format simplifies reporting by consolidating all necessary questions into one convenient platform, requiring you to answer only industry-specific content that directly relates to your company’s activities.
With key data items standardized across all sectors, the AIES offers holistic annual picture of the U.S. economy. Your valuable data serve as a critical input in calculating the Gross Domestic Product (GDP), empowering policymakers and businesses, including your own, make informed and data-driven decisions.
How do I know this is a legitimate government survey?
This survey has been approved by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB).
 
The eight-digit OMB approval number is 0607-1024 and appears in the lower left corner of each reporting screen. Without this approval, we could not conduct this survey. We are conducting this survey under the authority of Title 13, United States Code, Sections 131 and 182.
How long will it take to complete the survey?
We estimate the Annual Integrated Economic Survey will take an average of 2.5 hours to complete. Factors such as company size, complexity, and activity will affect your actual time to complete the survey. This estimate includes the time to review instructions, search existing data sources, gather and maintain the data needed, and complete and review the survey.
Will my response be confidential?
Yes. The U.S. Census Bureau is required by law to keep your response confidential (Title 13, U.S. Code, Section 9). The Census Bureau is not permitted to publicly release your responses in a way that could identify your business, organization, or institution. Per the Federal Cybersecurity Enhancement Act of 2015, your data are protected from cybersecurity risks through screening of the systems that transmit data.
Am I required to fill out the survey?
Yes. Your business is required by law (Title 13, U.S. Code, Sections 224 and 225) to respond to this survey.
How will the Census Bureau use the information I provide?
By law, the Census Bureau can only use your business data to produce statistics.
ID: 2015252446

subject: RE: [SUSPICIOUS MESSAGE] RE: Please review: Draft 1099
body:
This Message contains suspicious characteristics and has originated outside your organization.
Hello Chuck and Sarah,
Thank you for providing the information on both my 1099 and W2.
For the payment that is due, I wanted to let you know that will not reach out to Alisa directly.  I must protect my peace and since she refused mediation on other outstanding funds, I think it's best that we don't communicate directly. 
I'm owed $3, 250 for work completed and would like to be paid. If it has to be sent in installments, that fine as along as I'm paid.
Thank you,
Tamara 
Tamara Thorpe
Owner and Managing Principal Consultant
TNT Development
Empowering Leaders to Drive Transformation

---- On Thu, 13 Mar 2025 12:29:43 -0600 
accounting@lcwmail.com 
wrote ----
Hi Tamara,
 
Alisa says you can reach out to her directly about your payments, so please contact her.
 
Your W2 was generated electronically and downloadable through Zenefits. Since you probably don’t still have access, I’ll email it to you (from my firm’s email since the LCW firewall doesn’t like the SSN). That’s coming in a few minutes.
 
Let me know if you need anything else
 
SG

 Tamara Thorpe <
tamara@tamarathorpe.com
>

Hi Sarah,
 
I'm following up once again about the request you send to pay in installments. Can you please let me know what those installments will be? I also have not received my W2 from the time when I was salaried. Has that been prepared and sent?
 
Tamara

---- On Thu, 20 Feb 2025 13:44:47 -0700 
Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
 wrote ---
 
Hi Tamara,
 
Thanks for your patience on this, I’m sure you know how busy we’ve been.
 
Chuck and I reviewed our records, and we agree that based on your contract we do still owe you this payment of $3,250. It looks like we had only received 3 invoices from you, which is why that’s all that was paid in 2024, but I’ve set this one up manually and we’ll process as soon as we’re able.
 
Would it be ok with you if it’s broken into a few installments so that it helps our cash flows?
 
Also, I’m sending you an invitation from QuickBooks Money to set up your bank account for direct deposit. Let me know if you have any issues or would prefer that I enter the data manually.
 
Best,
 
“SG” Gluckstein

Hello Sarah,
 
Thank you for sending over the 1099; I have identified two errors and more more significant. Based upon this 1099, I only received 3 payments and I should have received four.  My contract with LCW was $6,500/month for March and April. I went through my records in Bill.com and it confirms that I received payment for April and only one payment in May when I worked the entirety of April. I am owed $3,250.
 
Please also find that my business address is:

Albuquerque, NM 87107

subject: PayPal electronic funds transfer
body:
Hello, Randall Stieghorst 
We are processing your request to transfer funds to your PayPal Balance account from your bank account ending in **35.
Processing usually takes 3-5 business days but may vary by bank.
We estimate that these funds will be deposited in your PayPal Balance account by Mar 18, 2025.
We will notify you by email if we have any problems processing your request.

subject: Salary what-if calculation
body:
To calculate these I took their gross pay for the current period, subtracted their deductions (401k, insurance, HSA contribution) since we can’t prepay those, and extended to 2 months.
 
Chuck: $19,900
Nicole: $15,300
 
Total $35,300
 
This would bring cash below $140,000
 
“SG” Gluckstein

SG

Subject:
 Re: Fw: Translation Coordinator - Onboarding documents
 
Hi SG,
 
Sorry for the delay! a lot of info to process here :)
I have my account in the US so no worries, I can receive everything there.
 
here are the details:
Payment deposit details:
Account Number: 4982147615 - Citibank
Bank Swift Code: CITIUS33
ABA Number: 021000089
 
 
Regarding timesheet, ill ask Lina to explain how to fill it in.
Thank you again!!
 
 
   
   Paula Cecilia Mariotta

Traductora  de Inglés
 
-

:

El lun, 10 mar 2025 a las 15:42, Accounting (<
accounting@lcwmail.com
>) escribió:
Hi Cecilia! Great to meet you.
 
Attached is your time sheet – since we are almost at the end of the quarter you’ll only fill out the last bit, and I’ll send out a new one for the 1
st
 of April. It should be pretty self-explanatory, but let me know if you have any questions. 
 
After the 15
th
 and the 30
th
 of each month, you’ll email your time sheet to Nicole for approval, and she will send it to me for processing. You’ll be paid about 2 weeks after the end of each period.
 
Regarding your payments, we have a few different options. If you have a US bank account (or use a service like Wise) we can send you ACH, and we can also send through PayPal. (International wire is usually available but our processor is having problems right now.) Let me know what you prefer and we’ll get you set up.
 
Best,
“SG” Gluckstein

El vie, 7 mar 2025 a las 14:00, Nicole Barile (<
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>) escribió:
Hello Cecilia,
 
We are looking forward to you joining our team this coming Monday!
 
Attached please find 
Contactor Agreement for your signature
. I highlighted the sections in yellow that need filling out.
Should you have trouble editing the doc, let me know.
 
I've also attached a 
W8 BEN
 form. We are required by the US government to have this on file. It just shows that you do not have to pay US taxes on this. Please return.
I've also attached the 
"Welcome slides"
 we looked at today around LCW's mission, our team, etc., just for your review.
 
And I've attached an 
operation manual
 that has some useful info, but I admit it is a bit dated.
 
Lastly, I will need your 
banking information
. I'm copying our bookkeeper, Sarah 
@Accounting
 - who we call SG 
🙂
. SG will give you instructions on how to fill out your timesheet for payment (which is every 2 weeks). [Thanks SG!]
Your LCW email will be set up by Monday, but in the meantime, I will send things to your gmail. I will add you to some of the systems that we use (Scoro is the main one, as well as Dropbox). You'll also get some invites to LCW meetings. No worries if you can't attend this first week - just let me know.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need anything else. I know this is a lot at once.
Thanks so much & have a great weekend!
Nicole
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

Thank you so much, Nicole! 
I’m looking forward to working with you.
 
Enjoy your weekend!
Jorgelina 
 
On Fri, 7 Feb 2025 at 7:23
 
PM Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hello Jor!
 
Please accept this email as your official offer to join LCW as a part time translation coordinator.  
I’m literally boarding my connecting flight to Mexico City, so I’ll send you the official paperwork and offer details early next week :). 
 
As for start date, if you can start Fri Feb 14 that would be good for us. Catalina can coordinate with you and train you, and I’ll set a call for the 3 of us to talk that day to make sure you have everything you need. 
 
I’ll also have calls with you the following week to ensure you are getting adjusted. 
 
Thanks for your patience and welcome to LCW!
You’ll meet everyone on Feb.17th at our all staff meeting. I’ll send those details to you as well. 
 
Lmk if you have any questions or need anything else. 
 
And THANK YOU Catalina for introducing us to Jorgelina and working with her through your transition!
 
Have a great weekend!
Nicole
 
 
On Feb 5, 2025, at 2:17
 
PM, Jor Venturi <
jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
> wrote:
﻿
Hi Nicole,
Apologies for the delayed response. I just got back from vacation with my family.
Please find my resume attached. Thursday works perfectly for me; I’m available at any time. Let me know what time suits you best.
Looking forward to our call!
 
Best regards,
Jorgelina
 
On Tue, Feb 4, 2025 at 4:11
 
PM Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hi Jorgelina,
 
It's nice to meet you! Thanks Catalina for the introduction.
I've moved Catalina to bcc.
 
It would be great to have your CV & set up a call to chat.
I'm not sure if you are available, but I'm free this Thursday at 2, 3:30 or 4pm EST (New York time). Would either time work for you?
 
Thank you!
Nicole
 
From:
 Catalina De Sanctis <
c.desanctis@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 4, 2025 11:11 AM
To:
 
Jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
 <
Jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
>; Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Translation Coordinator
 
 
Dear Nicole,
Let me introduce you to my dear friend and colleague for many years, Jorgelina Venturi.
She has been in the localization industry for more than 10 years and I can guarantee she can excel at this position.
She’s super active, friendly, professional and will bring a boost to LCW. Very good at client relationships and sales indeed.
I gave her heads up on how it would be to work for LCW and she is very interested.
 
@Jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
 may you please share CV with Nicole?
 
I’ll let you discuss but I can feel you’re an amazing match.
Let me know if anything.
Good luck!
Kindly,
CDS
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

subject: LCW remittance account question
body:
Hi Jennifer,
 
I’m hoping you can help me figure this out, or pass this along to someone who can.
 
A few months ago, I changed our bank account for invoice remittance in Ariba. However, the payment we received a couple weeks ago went to the previous account, which is no longer on file there. Our other client who uses Ariba remits payment to the new account. Can you help me ensure this gets switched going forward? We are going to be closing the old account.
 
Thank you,
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW

accounting@lcwmail.com

subject: RE: [SUSPICIOUS MESSAGE] RE: Please review: Draft 1099
body:
Hi Tamara,
 
Alisa says you can reach out to her directly about your payments, so please contact her.
 
Your W2 was generated electronically and downloadable through Zenefits. Since you probably don’t still have access, I’ll email it to you (from my firm’s email since the LCW firewall doesn’t like the SSN). That’s coming in a few minutes.
 
Let me know if you need anything else
 
SG

Hi Tamara,
 
Thanks for your patience on this, I’m sure you know how busy we’ve been.
 
Chuck and I reviewed our records, and we agree that based on your contract we do still owe you this payment of $3,250. It looks like we had only received 3 invoices from you, which is why that’s all that was paid in 2024, but I’ve set this one up manually and we’ll process as soon as we’re able.
 
Would it be ok with you if it’s broken into a few installments so that it helps our cash flows?
 
Also, I’m sending you an invitation from QuickBooks Money to set up your bank account for direct deposit. Let me know if you have any issues or would prefer that I enter the data manually.
 
Best,

subject: Re: Fw: Translation Coordinator - Onboarding documents
body:
Hi SG,
Sorry for the delay! a lot of info to process here :)
I have my account in the US so no worries, I can receive everything there.
here are the details:
Payment deposit details:
Account Number: 4982147615 - Citibank
Bank Swift Code: CITIUS33
ABA Number: 021000089
Regarding timesheet, ill ask Lina to explain how to fill it in.
Thank you again!!
   
   Paula Cecilia Mariotta
   -
Traductora  de Inglés
 
-
 
     
 
Mobile
: 
54-9-3572-447567
       
Skype
:
 
 ceciliamariotta 
     
  LinkedIn
:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/cecilia-mariotta
 
 
El lun, 10 mar 2025 a las 15:42, Accounting (<
accounting@lcwmail.com
>) escribió:
Hi Cecilia! Great to meet you.
 
Attached is your time sheet – since we are almost at the end of the quarter you’ll only fill out the last bit, and I’ll send out a new one for the 1
st
 of April. It should be pretty self-explanatory, but let me know if you have any questions. 
 
After the 15
th
 and the 30
th
 of each month, you’ll email your time sheet to Nicole for approval, and she will send it to me for processing. You’ll be paid about 2 weeks after the end of each period.
 
Regarding your payments, we have a few different options. If you have a US bank account (or use a service like Wise) we can send you ACH, and we can also send through PayPal. (International wire is usually available but our processor is having problems right now.) Let me know what you prefer and we’ll get you set up.
 
Best,
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW

El vie, 7 mar 2025 a las 14:00, Nicole Barile (<
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>) escribió:
Hello Cecilia,
 
We are looking forward to you joining our team this coming Monday!
 
Attached please find 
Contactor Agreement for your signature
. I highlighted the sections in yellow that need filling out.
Should you have trouble editing the doc, let me know.
 
I've also attached a 
W8 BEN
 form. We are required by the US government to have this on file. It just shows that you do not have to pay US taxes on this. Please return.
I've also attached the 
"Welcome slides"
 we looked at today around LCW's mission, our team, etc., just for your review.
 
And I've attached an 
operation manual
 that has some useful info, but I admit it is a bit dated.
 
Lastly, I will need your 
banking information
. I'm copying our bookkeeper, Sarah 
@Accounting
 - who we call SG 
🙂
. SG will give you instructions on how to fill out your timesheet for payment (which is every 2 weeks). [Thanks SG!]
Your LCW email will be set up by Monday, but in the meantime, I will send things to your gmail. I will add you to some of the systems that we use (Scoro is the main one, as well as Dropbox). You'll also get some invites to LCW meetings. No worries if you can't attend this first week - just let me know.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need anything else. I know this is a lot at once.
Thanks so much & have a great weekend!
Nicole
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

On Fri, 7 Feb 2025 at 7:23
 
PM Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hello Jor!
 
Please accept this email as your official offer to join LCW as a part time translation coordinator.  
I’m literally boarding my connecting flight to Mexico City, so I’ll send you the official paperwork and offer details early next week :). 
 
As for start date, if you can start Fri Feb 14 that would be good for us. Catalina can coordinate with you and train you, and I’ll set a call for the 3 of us to talk that day to make sure you have everything you need. 
 
I’ll also have calls with you the following week to ensure you are getting adjusted. 
 
Thanks for your patience and welcome to LCW!
You’ll meet everyone on Feb.17th at our all staff meeting. I’ll send those details to you as well. 
 
Lmk if you have any questions or need anything else. 
 
And THANK YOU Catalina for introducing us to Jorgelina and working with her through your transition!
 
Have a great weekend!
Nicole
 
 
On Feb 5, 2025, at 2:17
 
PM, Jor Venturi <
jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
> wrote:
﻿
Hi Nicole,
Apologies for the delayed response. I just got back from vacation with my family.
Please find my resume attached. Thursday works perfectly for me; I’m available at any time. Let me know what time suits you best.
Looking forward to our call!
 
Best regards,
Jorgelina
 
On Tue, Feb 4, 2025 at 4:11
 
PM Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hi Jorgelina,
 
It's nice to meet you! Thanks Catalina for the introduction.
I've moved Catalina to bcc.
 
It would be great to have your CV & set up a call to chat.
I'm not sure if you are available, but I'm free this Thursday at 2, 3:30 or 4pm EST (New York time). Would either time work for you?
 
Thank you!
Nicole
 
From:
 Catalina De Sanctis <
c.desanctis@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 4, 2025 11:11 AM
To:
 
Jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
 <
Jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
>; Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Translation Coordinator
 
 
Dear Nicole,
Let me introduce you to my dear friend and colleague for many years, Jorgelina Venturi.
She has been in the localization industry for more than 10 years and I can guarantee she can excel at this position.
She’s super active, friendly, professional and will bring a boost to LCW. Very good at client relationships and sales indeed.
I gave her heads up on how it would be to work for LCW and she is very interested.
 
@Jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
 may you please share CV with Nicole?
 
I’ll let you discuss but I can feel you’re an amazing match.
Let me know if anything.
Good luck!
Kindly,
CDS
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

subject: Re: QB Payroll + Benefits
body:
Hey SG. I will copy you on my email to Rippling but wanted to share this too in case you want to look:
https://view.rippling.com/viewer/9a6fcc848b496a30a2131d9b00ce1656?q_mailing_7TUvzhdFxJeQo9QbskUkwM2GSjQG1DQufGkZA=RoodQqvyKBMtHBW2waJNJHSSQWXhcFFbReq3CSUYRDcaPj8Mi3WjmmEVh
There are several short videos available about their platform. I watched "Intro to Rippling" & "US Payroll." Seems very similar to TriNet, but it does look like a better experience.
From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, March 6, 2025 3:23 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: QB Payroll + Benefits
 
 
Thanks for the info! I love data.
 
Go ahead and put a meeting on my calendar at a time you like, it’s up to date.
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, March 6, 2025 09:36
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: QB Payroll + Benefits
 
Yes, that would be great. Should I find a time early next week, or do you prefer to schedule?
 
Maybe too much info for you, but here is the pricing based on different scenarios for both HR & IT. If we move to Rippling, we would also use them for IT - they are much cheaper than AIS!
 
Currently pay:
$1,700/yr w Trinet
$5,160/yr w AIS (not counting tech support)
$6,660/yr Total
Adjusted AIS to current 5 computers
$1,700/yr w Trinet
$2,376/yr w AIS (not counting tech support...and making assumptions about Mimecast)
$4,076/yr Total
Rippling HR & payroll only + AIS (adjusted)
$1,380 - Rippling HR + payroll
$2,376 - AIS
$3,656/yr Total
Rippling for all
$1,380 - Rippling HR + payroll 
$840 - Rippling IT
$2,220/yr Total
QuickBooks Payroll + AIS (adjusted)
$660 - QuickBooks payroll ($25/mo + $6pp)
$2,376 - AIS
$3,036 /yr Total
 
 
From:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Thursday, March 6, 2025 10:33 AM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: QB Payroll + Benefits
 
Hey Nicole,
I haven’t started on QB payroll yet, and I’m not familiar with Rippling but definitely open to it. Should we set up a quick meeting sometime to review what we want to do?
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 5, 2025 12:06
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: QB Payroll + Benefits
 
Hi again.
 
Sorry for my all over the place emails. Things are moving so quickly that it's like they're changing every second!
 
After I sent the below email, I had a chat with Rippling about maybe having them replace TriNet. They do payroll too.
 
Have you started adding QB payroll yet? I'd like to pause as I consider Rippling as an alternative. Not sure if you have worked with Rippling before...
 
Thank you!
 
 
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 5, 2025 10:56 AM
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 QB Payroll + Benefits
 
Hey SG!
 
Not sure if you are aware, but TriNet is changing plans, and I'm looking for other options for managing our benefits.
 
I have discovered that QBO offer a similar "broker" model through Allstate Health Solutions.
https://quickbooks.intuit.com/r/product-update/allstate-health-solutions-payroll/
 
It seems that once we add QB payroll, we can then add Benefits (through Allstate), and that this is no extra cost to us.
 
I'm happy to set this up & come to you if I need assistance or another pair of eyes.
 
The first step is that I connect our existing benefits plan. This doesn't actually initiate a switchover - but it allows us/me to start the process when I'm ready.
 
Anyway...long story short... Can you please lmk when Quickbooks Payroll will be added?
 
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile

subject: Please sign in to your account to ensure you continue to receive SAP Fieldglass email notifications. [Supplier: Schondelmayer, Alsu]
body:
Dear Schondelmayer, Alsu
SAP Fieldglass email notifications will be turned off for your account with the username [aschondelmayer] due to inactivity in the last 6 months.
Please sign in within the next 7 days if you would like to continue to receive notifications from SAP Fieldglass. If this account is no longer used, no action is required.
Once signed in, SAP Fieldglass Administrator users can confirm the names of any buyer companies this profile actively serves by selecting the Admin icon, then Buyer.
Details
Supplier: Schondelmayer, Alsu
This notification was sent by the SAP Fieldglass system.
If you have any questions regarding this notice, access 
https://support.fieldglass.com/Help_Center/Fieldglass?persona=FGsupplier
to find documentation or submit a support case.
Please do not respond to this email

subject: FW: Annual Refiling Survey - PASSWORD
body:
bump
 
From:
 AnnualRefilingSurvey@bls.gov <AnnualRefilingSurvey@bls.gov> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 25, 2025 10:20
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Annual Refiling Survey - PASSWORD
 
Dear Employer,
To complete the Annual Refiling Survey (ARS) online, please use the WEBID(s) from the email you recently received with the subject line: 'Annual Refiling Survey Notice', along with your password(s) below to log on to our secure website: 
https://idcfars.bls.gov/
 
PASSWORD 1: 
Qo593523
PASSWORD 2: 
Ts365767
PASSWORD 3: 
Sz493312
PASSWORD 4: 
Sj143866
If you copy and paste the password, please ensure that you are only copying the 8 character password and no spaces before or after. 
If you cannot locate the Annual Refiling Survey Notice email in your inbox or SPAM folder, you can submit a request to have your survey notice resent: 
https://data.bls.gov/cgi-bin/forms/ars?/respondents/ars/home.htm
 
Additional information regarding this survey can be found at: 
https://www.bls.gov/respondents/ars
 
Thank you,
U.S. Department of Labor
Bureau of Labor Statistics
 
How do I know this email is from the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics? 
Links in this email will start with https:// and contain 'bls.gov.' Your browser will display a padlock or tune icon to let you know connection to a site is secure. You can also type the address directly into your browser window.
 
The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) is committed to the responsible treatment of confidential information and takes rigorous security measures to protect confidential information in its possession. This email contains confidential information. If you believe you are not the intended recipient of this message, please notify the sender and delete this email without disclosing, copying, or further disseminating its contents.

subject: Re: Fw: Translation Coordinator - Onboarding documents
body:
Thank you!
From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, March 10, 2025 2:42 PM
To:
 Paula Cecilia Mariotta <ceciliamariotta@gmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Fw: Translation Coordinator - Onboarding documents
 
 
Hi Cecilia! Great to meet you.
 
Attached is your time sheet – since we are almost at the end of the quarter you’ll only fill out the last bit, and I’ll send out a new one for the 1
st
 of April. It should be pretty self-explanatory, but let me know if you have any questions. 
 
After the 15
th
 and the 30
th
 of each month, you’ll email your time sheet to Nicole for approval, and she will send it to me for processing. You’ll be paid about 2 weeks after the end of each period.
 
Regarding your payments, we have a few different options. If you have a US bank account (or use a service like Wise) we can send you ACH, and we can also send through PayPal. (International wire is usually available but our processor is having problems right now.) Let me know what you prefer and we’ll get you set up.
 
Best,
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW

El vie, 7 mar 2025 a las 14:00, Nicole Barile (<
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>) escribió:
Hello Cecilia,
 
We are looking forward to you joining our team this coming Monday!
 
Attached please find 
Contactor Agreement for your signature
. I highlighted the sections in yellow that need filling out.
Should you have trouble editing the doc, let me know.
 
I've also attached a 
W8 BEN
 form. We are required by the US government to have this on file. It just shows that you do not have to pay US taxes on this. Please return.
I've also attached the 
"Welcome slides"
 we looked at today around LCW's mission, our team, etc., just for your review.
 
And I've attached an 
operation manual
 that has some useful info, but I admit it is a bit dated.
 
Lastly, I will need your 
banking information
. I'm copying our bookkeeper, Sarah 
@Accounting
 - who we call SG 
🙂
. SG will give you instructions on how to fill out your timesheet for payment (which is every 2 weeks). [Thanks SG!]
Your LCW email will be set up by Monday, but in the meantime, I will send things to your gmail. I will add you to some of the systems that we use (Scoro is the main one, as well as Dropbox). You'll also get some invites to LCW meetings. No worries if you can't attend this first week - just let me know.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need anything else. I know this is a lot at once.
Thanks so much & have a great weekend!
Nicole
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

From:
 Jor Venturi <
jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
>
Sent:
 Friday, February 7, 2025 5:36 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Translation Coordinator
 
 
Thank you so much, Nicole! 
I’m looking forward to working with you.
 
Enjoy your weekend!
Jorgelina 
 
On Fri, 7 Feb 2025 at 7:23
 
PM Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hello Jor!
 
Please accept this email as your official offer to join LCW as a part time translation coordinator.  
I’m literally boarding my connecting flight to Mexico City, so I’ll send you the official paperwork and offer details early next week :). 
 
As for start date, if you can start Fri Feb 14 that would be good for us. Catalina can coordinate with you and train you, and I’ll set a call for the 3 of us to talk that day to make sure you have everything you need. 
 
I’ll also have calls with you the following week to ensure you are getting adjusted. 
 
Thanks for your patience and welcome to LCW!
You’ll meet everyone on Feb.17th at our all staff meeting. I’ll send those details to you as well. 
 
Lmk if you have any questions or need anything else. 
 
And THANK YOU Catalina for introducing us to Jorgelina and working with her through your transition!
 
Have a great weekend!
Nicole
 
 
On Feb 5, 2025, at 2:17
 
PM, Jor Venturi <
jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
> wrote:
﻿
Hi Nicole,
Apologies for the delayed response. I just got back from vacation with my family.
Please find my resume attached. Thursday works perfectly for me; I’m available at any time. Let me know what time suits you best.
Looking forward to our call!
 
Best regards,
Jorgelina
 
On Tue, Feb 4, 2025 at 4:11
 
PM Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hi Jorgelina,
 
It's nice to meet you! Thanks Catalina for the introduction.
I've moved Catalina to bcc.
 
It would be great to have your CV & set up a call to chat.
I'm not sure if you are available, but I'm free this Thursday at 2, 3:30 or 4pm EST (New York time). Would either time work for you?
 
Thank you!
Nicole
 
From:
 Catalina De Sanctis <
c.desanctis@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 4, 2025 11:11 AM
To:
 
Jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
 <
Jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
>; Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Translation Coordinator
 
 
Dear Nicole,
Let me introduce you to my dear friend and colleague for many years, Jorgelina Venturi.
She has been in the localization industry for more than 10 years and I can guarantee she can excel at this position.
She’s super active, friendly, professional and will bring a boost to LCW. Very good at client relationships and sales indeed.
I gave her heads up on how it would be to work for LCW and she is very interested.
 
@Jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com
 may you please share CV with Nicole?
 
I’ll let you discuss but I can feel you’re an amazing match.
Let me know if anything.
Good luck!
Kindly,
CDS
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Importance:
 High
 
New Procedure for Updating ACH instructions – Effective February 13, 2025.
 
Dear Alisa,
 
Lendlease has implemented a new procedure for 
updating ACH instructions
 and creating new ACH accounts.
 
To ensure compliance, please follow these steps:
 
The Master Data Manager will contact the authorized user of the bank account to verify account details.  The process will include:  
Confirming that the individual on the call is an authorized user of the establshiment’s bank account.
Validating the banking instructions associated with the account.
Ensuring the account is current and complete.
 
 
You may email a time and date where it would work for you to get on a call.  You may also try to call at 704-357-6551.
 
Best Regards,
 
 
Jessica M. Hernández

Manager of Master Data, MDM Group for the Americas/ ERN

Hi Carol,
 
I had the hierarchy updated.  I’m sorry, you’ll have to delete the requisition below and start again.  Please use today’s date for the expense, otherwise you will get the same issue when you submit.  The change of banking information should go to

Importance:
 High
 
New Procedure for Updating ACH instructions – Effective February 13, 2025.
 
Dear Alisa,
 
Lendlease has implemented a new procedure for 
updating ACH instructions
 and creating new ACH accounts.
 
To ensure compliance, please follow these steps:
 
The Master Data Manager will contact the authorized user of the bank account to verify account details.  The process will include:  
Confirming that the individual on the call is an authorized user of the establshiment’s bank account.
Validating the banking instructions associated with the account.
Ensuring the account is current and complete.
 
 
You may email a time and date where it would work for you to get on a call.  You may also try to call at 704-357-6551.
 
Best Regards,
 
 
Jessica M. Hernández
 
She/Her/Hers
Manager of Master Data, MDM Group for the Americas/ ERN
2320 Cascade Pointe Boulevard, Suite 300, Charlotte, NC 28208
T 704-357-6551 | M 980-433-7903 | F  704-357-2854

subject: Fw: Invoice 90098 AIS
body:
Hi there.
I believe this is our last outstanding AIS invoice. They took of $25 (from the issue Alisa mentioned).
LMK if you have any questions or need anything else.
Thank you!
From:
 John Ryan <jryan@aislabs.com>
Sent:
 Friday, March 7, 2025 5:28 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Jessica Moore <jmoore@aislabs.com>; AIS Billing <billing@aislabs.com>
Subject:
 RE: Invoice 90098
 
 
Nicole,
 
I heard back from AIS’ Billing Department on this matter. AIS’ Billing Department has informed me that “
we can issue a 
$25 credit
 this time but moving forward we ask that any questions or disputes are received within 
15 days
 receipt of the invoice.
”
 
The credit has been applied. Updated Invoice 90098 is attached.
 
Important
: It does state on every invoice that questions or disputes are to be received within 
15 days
 of invoice receipt.
 
-John

support@aislabs.com

(247-5227)

-John

Subject:
 RE: Invoice 90098
 
Nicole,
 
T20241018.0124 and T20241017.0251
: I have investigated this, and I see that both tickets were initiated by Alisa’s Email to Andrew Dillard. Kelsey, the technician who worked on 
Ticket# T20241018.0124
, also acknowledged that this was a duplicate ticket in the ticket notes. As such, I am checking with the AIS Billing Department to see if a credit can be issued for this ticket from the October Invoice. I may not have an answer back on this until next week.
 
To be clear, the best way to initiate a ticket would be to do one of the following:
 
1) Email 
support@aislabs.com
 (as it says in my email signature below).
2) Email me and I can create a ticket.
3) Enter a ticket in your AIS or VSA Portal.
 
Please 
DO NOT
 email our technicians directly to initiate a new ticket or request additional service after a ticket has been completed.
 
I will be sure to let you know as soon as I hear back from the Billing Department.
 
Thank you.
 
-John

body:

Webcast Announcement
 
 
 
Real-Time Support for Procurement Webcasts
Introduction to Supplier Certificate Updates
The SAP Ariba Business Network
 
support team is launching an updated supplier webcast with insights on the supplier certificate overview, understanding the different connection types, and common errors involved. Additionally, the team will address the valuable details and resources behind the certificate updates, the steps for suppliers to take, and a demonstration to conclude the presentation.

New Procedure for Updating ACH instructions – Effective February 13, 2025.
 
Dear Alisa,
 
Lendlease has implemented a new procedure for 
updating ACH instructions
 and creating new ACH accounts.
 
To ensure compliance, please follow these steps:
 
The Master Data Manager will contact the authorized user of the bank account to verify account details.  The process will include:  
Confirming that the individual on the call is an authorized user of the establshiment’s bank account.
Validating the banking instructions associated with the account.
Ensuring the account is current and complete.
 
 
You may email a time and date where it would work for you to get on a call.  You may also try to call at 704-357-6551.
 
Best Regards,

subject: RE: Invoice
body:
It wouldn’t speed up the process on our end, but you’d be able to manage your own bank information and get emails updating you on the progress, as well as download an electronic 1099 at year end.
 
I’ll talk to Nicole about if we can do quicker than usual payment terms for you. I process on the 1
st
 and 15
th
 of each month, so it’s just a question of which one it will be.
 
SG

subject: RE: QB Payroll + Benefits
body:
Thanks for the info! I love data.
 
Go ahead and put a meeting on my calendar at a time you like, it’s up to date.
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, March 6, 2025 09:36
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: QB Payroll + Benefits
 
Yes, that would be great. Should I find a time early next week, or do you prefer to schedule?
 
Maybe too much info for you, but here is the pricing based on different scenarios for both HR & IT. If we move to Rippling, we would also use them for IT - they are much cheaper than AIS!
 
Currently pay:
$1,700/yr w Trinet
$5,160/yr w AIS (not counting tech support)
$6,660/yr Total
Adjusted AIS to current 5 computers
$1,700/yr w Trinet
$2,376/yr w AIS (not counting tech support...and making assumptions about Mimecast)
$4,076/yr Total
Rippling HR & payroll only + AIS (adjusted)
$1,380 - Rippling HR + payroll
$2,376 - AIS
$3,656/yr Total
Rippling for all
$1,380 - Rippling HR + payroll 
$840 - Rippling IT
$2,220/yr Total
QuickBooks Payroll + AIS (adjusted)
$660 - QuickBooks payroll ($25/mo + $6pp)
$2,376 - AIS
$3,036 /yr Total
 
 
From:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Thursday, March 6, 2025 10:33 AM
To:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: QB Payroll + Benefits
 
 
Hey Nicole,
I haven’t started on QB payroll yet, and I’m not familiar with Rippling but definitely open to it. Should we set up a quick meeting sometime to review what we want to do?
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 5, 2025 12:06
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: QB Payroll + Benefits
 
Hi again.
 
Sorry for my all over the place emails. Things are moving so quickly that it's like they're changing every second!
 
After I sent the below email, I had a chat with Rippling about maybe having them replace TriNet. They do payroll too.
 
Have you started adding QB payroll yet? I'd like to pause as I consider Rippling as an alternative. Not sure if you have worked with Rippling before...
 
Thank you!
 
 
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 5, 2025 10:56 AM
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 QB Payroll + Benefits
 
 
Hey SG!
 
Not sure if you are aware, but TriNet is changing plans, and I'm looking for other options for managing our benefits.
 
I have discovered that QBO offer a similar "broker" model through Allstate Health Solutions.
https://quickbooks.intuit.com/r/product-update/allstate-health-solutions-payroll/
 
It seems that once we add QB payroll, we can then add Benefits (through Allstate), and that this is no extra cost to us.
 
I'm happy to set this up & come to you if I need assistance or another pair of eyes.
 
The first step is that I connect our existing benefits plan. This doesn't actually initiate a switchover - but it allows us/me to start the process when I'm ready.
 
Anyway...long story short... Can you please lmk when Quickbooks Payroll will be added?
 
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: Re: QB Payroll + Benefits
body:
Yes, that would be great. Should I find a time early next week, or do you prefer to schedule?
Maybe too much info for you, but here is the pricing based on different scenarios for both HR & IT. If we move to Rippling, we would also use them for IT - they are much cheaper than AIS!
Currently pay:
$1,700/yr w Trinet
$5,160/yr w AIS (not counting tech support)
$6,660/yr Total
Adjusted AIS to current 5 computers
$1,700/yr w Trinet
$2,376/yr w AIS (not counting tech support...and making assumptions about Mimecast)
$4,076/yr Total
Rippling HR & payroll only + AIS (adjusted)
$1,380 - Rippling HR + payroll
$2,376 - AIS
$3,656/yr Total
Rippling for all
$1,380 - Rippling HR + payroll 
$840 - Rippling IT
$2,220/yr Total
QuickBooks Payroll + AIS (adjusted)
$660 - QuickBooks payroll ($25/mo + $6pp)
$2,376 - AIS
$3,036 /yr Total

 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, March 6, 2025 10:33 AM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: QB Payroll + Benefits
 
 
Hey Nicole,
I haven’t started on QB payroll yet, and I’m not familiar with Rippling but definitely open to it. Should we set up a quick meeting sometime to review what we want to do?
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 5, 2025 12:06
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: QB Payroll + Benefits
 
Hi again.
 
Sorry for my all over the place emails. Things are moving so quickly that it's like they're changing every second!
 
After I sent the below email, I had a chat with Rippling about maybe having them replace TriNet. They do payroll too.
 
Have you started adding QB payroll yet? I'd like to pause as I consider Rippling as an alternative. Not sure if you have worked with Rippling before...
 
Thank you!
 
 
From:
 Nicole Barile
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 5, 2025 10:56 AM
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 QB Payroll + Benefits
 
 
Hey SG!
 
Not sure if you are aware, but TriNet is changing plans, and I'm looking for other options for managing our benefits.
 
I have discovered that QBO offer a similar "broker" model through Allstate Health Solutions.
https://quickbooks.intuit.com/r/product-update/allstate-health-solutions-payroll/
 
It seems that once we add QB payroll, we can then add Benefits (through Allstate), and that this is no extra cost to us.
 
I'm happy to set this up & come to you if I need assistance or another pair of eyes.
 
The first step is that I connect our existing benefits plan. This doesn't actually initiate a switchover - but it allows us/me to start the process when I'm ready.
 
Anyway...long story short... Can you please lmk when Quickbooks Payroll will be added?
 
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile

SG

From:
 Hernandez, Jessica 
Sent:
 Tuesday, March 4, 2025 12:41 PM
To:
 accounting@lcwmail.com
Cc:
 Rzeszewicz, Linda <Linda.Rzeszewicz@lendlease.com>
Subject:
 RE: ACH Request -LCW;Work item ID-3626550;Exception: External -Approval Required;3284767
Importance:
 High
 
New Procedure for Updating ACH instructions – Effective February 13, 2025.
 
Dear Alisa,
 
Lendlease has implemented a new procedure for 
updating ACH instructions
 and creating new ACH accounts.
 
To ensure compliance, please follow these steps:
 
The Master Data Manager will contact the authorized user of the bank account to verify account details.  The process will include:  
Confirming that the individual on the call is an authorized user of the establshiment’s bank account.
Validating the banking instructions associated with the account.
Ensuring the account is current and complete.
 
 
You may email a time and date where it would work for you to get on a call.  You may also try to call at 704-357-6551.
 
Best Regards,
 
 
Jessica M. Hernández

Manager of Master Data, MDM Group for the Americas/ ERN

subject: RE: ACH Request -LCW;Work item ID-3626550;Exception: External -Approval Required;3284767
body:
New Procedure for Updating ACH instructions – Effective February 13, 2025.
 
Dear Alisa,
 
Lendlease has implemented a new procedure for 
updating ACH instructions
 and creating new ACH accounts.
 
To ensure compliance, please follow these steps:
 
The Master Data Manager will contact the authorized user of the bank account to verify account details.  The process will include:  
Confirming that the individual on the call is an authorized user of the establshiment’s bank account.
Validating the banking instructions associated with the account.
Ensuring the account is current and complete.
 
 
You may email a time and date where it would work for you to get on a call.  You may also try to call at 704-357-6551.
 
Best Regards,
 
 
Jessica M. Hernández
 
She/Her/Hers
Manager of Master Data, MDM Group for the Americas/ ERN
2320 Cascade Pointe Boulevard, Suite 300, Charlotte, NC 28208
T 704-357-6551 | M 980-433-7903 | F  704-357-2854

We are requesting a current Accounts Receivable statement that includes all accounts and locations that Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. has with your company. This request is part of a comprehensive review of our Accounts Payable transactions, conducted in conjunction with Apex Analytix.

Subject:

Hi Gaelle,
 
I hope the new year has been treating you well! We are working on closing our books for 2024 and need to determine how these aging invoices will be reconciled.
 
You indicated below that the 2023 invoice #17240362-EXP could be handled as an exception, and there’s also #24014-EXP-B which was for a session in 2024 – the two total $1,574.40. Can you please let us know if we can get those finalized? I don’t have a record of anything coming in for them. I’ve attached them in case you need to refresh your memory, and copied our leadership in case you need to discuss it with them.
 
Thanks very much,
 
“SG” Gluckstein

Subject:
 Aging LCW invoices
 
Hi Gaelle,
 
I hope the new year has been treating you well! We are working on closing our books for 2024 and need to determine how these aging invoices will be reconciled.
 
You indicated below that the 2023 invoice #17240362-EXP could be handled as an exception, and there’s also #24014-EXP-B which was for a session in 2024 – the two total $1,574.40. Can you please let us know if we can get those finalized? I don’t have a record of anything coming in for them. I’ve attached them in case you need to refresh your memory, and copied our leadership in case you need to discuss it with them.
 
Thanks very much,

subject: AJNJAA52000285501L - Johnson & Johnson for LANGUAGE AND CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
body:
Dear Valued Supplier,
We are requesting a current Accounts Receivable statement that includes all accounts and locations that Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. has with your company. This request is part of a comprehensive review of our Accounts Payable transactions, conducted in conjunction with Apex Analytix.
 
A complete statement should include all open invoices, credits, rebates, unapplied cash, prepayments on account, overpayments, duplicate payments, and aged deposits.
 
Please note that this is a special request, and we kindly ask that you do not send copies of open invoices or update any address or contact information you currently have for submitting invoices and related documents. If you require assistance, you may visit our vendor portal at 
www.ap.jnj.com
.

subject: Weekly Accounting update 3/3/25
body:
Hi Team, hope it’s been a good Monday!
 
This week’s reports are attached – no video since it’s pretty similar to previous. Chuck’s new SOW for Gap was already in the forecast, and translation only has a couple of things on the calendar right now, so no updates to receivables. However, I updated a bunch of recurring expense amounts per our latest payroll run. 
Our big red line of concern is now in July!!
 
I’m going to start working on setting us up for QB Payroll later this week, and will let you know with any issues I run into.
 
Have a good one!
 
“SG” Gluckstein

body:
OK – I will probably send the ACH via QB Bill Pay from the Citi Deposit account, since I don’t have payor authority on Village Bank and can’t send ACH from them directly. I could attach the account to our QB if it matters, but I think moving things to Citi as much as possible is preferable. Once we switch to QB for Payroll next month that can draw on Citi as well.
 
Let me know if Citi via QB is good, and I’ll process on the 12
th
 which is the withdrawal date for that payroll.
 
SG

Hi SG!
 
I finally have the "final" answer on what to do with my HSA.
 
I will add the HSA deduction in TriNet to the draft payroll run for Feb.15-Mar.1. When I enter this amount, TriNet calculates & adjust the taxes accordingly.
 
Then when you / Alisa go to pay payroll, you would take the HSA deduction amount I've designated in TriNet (I'll set it for a flat $1k to be easy) & send it to my Health Equity account via ACH - info attached.
 
Copying Alisa for awareness.
 
Do you have any questions or need more info?
 
Thanks so much!
 
 
Nicole Barile

Hey there.... More HSA stuff 
🙂
.
 
It seems setting up the HSA through TriNet was not the correct route. I'm just going to ignore that (not bother to cancel) since we won't be using them much longer.
 
I've investigated on my own & think I understand what needs to be done.
 
I set up a new payroll deduction type in TriNet - HSA - pre-tax. I added it as a one-time payment instead of a % of salary.
 
If you go into Payroll & then to my name, you can add that new deduction type (HSA) and add the amount. See screenshot.
 
Here are more instructions: 
https://help.zenefits.com/Payroll/Payroll_App/Managing_Deductions__Contributions/How_do_I_add_a_one-time_deduction_or_contribution_to_employees_in_Payroll%3F?mt-view=f1
.
 
I haven't gone further, as I'm not 100% sure if this is correct.
Do you think it is?
 
What I don't know is how to tell the system to send the money to my Health Equity HSA account. I've attached the banking info for said account. 
 
Do you think you can help? I feel like I'm 90% of the way there 
🙂
.
 
Happy to schedule a call to talk thru as well.
 
BTW, my thought is to make 2 giant deductions from my next 2 paychecks so that I can max it out this year & we don't have to look at this ever again...until next year 
🙂
.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

Hello Nicole,
Thank you for clarifying. I wouldn't be able to assist you with how to deduct those funds from your paycheck pretax as that is something your payroll team will need to assist you with. I will be able to help go over how to submit the contributions once they are deducted though.
Since you are wanting to use the routing and account numbers to submit those contributions, you will just give the routing and account numbers to your payroll company. They will then be able to submit the contributions as direct deposits to those routing and account numbers for you. There are a few things to note with submitting your contributions that way though.
The routing and account (PPD) numbers can be found on the employer portal under the reports. There is a quick link on the portal home page that says PPD Account Numbers. The first and most important thing to know about is that 
this page of the employer portal is 
not
 copy and paste compatible, copying and pasting from this page will scramble the numbers to make them incorrect
. Y
ou will want to use the export button at the top of the page to export the info to an excel spreadsheet if you intend to distribute the info to your payroll team. The second important thing to know about PPD contributions is that our system registers all direct deposit contributions as 
Employee Contributions
. So, if employer contributions are ever made, our system will track them as employee contributions only. 
If in the future, you decide to make contributions in a different way, you can also submit your pretax contributions through the Manage Money>HSA Contribution>Submit by Employee Listing page in the employer portal. The attached guide can help you set that up if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,
Cari S.
Client Services Consultant l
HealthEquity
O: 866-382-3510
employerservices@healthequity.com

I could attach the account to our QB if it matters, but I think moving things to Citi as much as possible is preferable. Once we switch to QB for Payroll next month that can draw on Citi as well.
 
Let me know if Citi via QB is good, and I’ll process on the 12
th
 which is the withdrawal date for that payroll.
 
SG

Hey there.... More HSA stuff 
🙂
.
 
It seems setting up the HSA through TriNet was not the correct route. I'm just going to ignore that (not bother to cancel) since we won't be using them much longer.
 
I've investigated on my own & think I understand what needs to be done.
 
I set up a new payroll deduction type in TriNet - HSA - pre-tax. I added it as a one-time payment instead of a % of salary.
 
If you go into Payroll & then to my name, you can add that new deduction type (HSA) and add the amount. See screenshot.
 
Here are more instructions: 
https://help.zenefits.com/Payroll/Payroll_App/Managing_Deductions__Contributions/How_do_I_add_a_one-time_deduction_or_contribution_to_employees_in_Payroll%3F?mt-view=f1
.
 
I haven't gone further, as I'm not 100% sure if this is correct.
Do you think it is?
 
What I don't know is how to tell the system to send the money to my Health Equity HSA account. I've attached the banking info for said account. 
 
Do you think you can help? I feel like I'm 90% of the way there 
🙂
.
 
Happy to schedule a call to talk thru as well.
 
BTW, my thought is to make 2 giant deductions from my next 2 paychecks so that I can max it out this year & we don't have to look at this ever again...until next year 
🙂
.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile

subject: Aging LCW invoices
body:
Hi Gaelle,
 
I hope the new year has been treating you well! We are working on closing our books for 2024 and need to determine how these aging invoices will be reconciled.
 
You indicated below that the 2023 invoice #17240362-EXP could be handled as an exception, and there’s also #24014-EXP-B which was for a session in 2024 – the two total $1,574.40. Can you please let us know if we can get those finalized? I don’t have a record of anything coming in for them. I’ve attached them in case you need to refresh your memory, and copied our leadership in case you need to discuss it with them.
 
Thanks very much,

Hey there.... More HSA stuff 
🙂
.
 
It seems setting up the HSA through TriNet was not the correct route. I'm just going to ignore that (not bother to cancel) since we won't be using them much longer.
 
I've investigated on my own & think I understand what needs to be done.
 
I set up a new payroll deduction type in TriNet - HSA - pre-tax. I added it as a one-time payment instead of a % of salary.
 
If you go into Payroll & then to my name, you can add that new deduction type (HSA) and add the amount. See screenshot.
 
Here are more instructions: 
https://help.zenefits.com/Payroll/Payroll_App/Managing_Deductions__Contributions/How_do_I_add_a_one-time_deduction_or_contribution_to_employees_in_Payroll%3F?mt-view=f1
.
 
I haven't gone further, as I'm not 100% sure if this is correct.
Do you think it is?
 
What I don't know is how to tell the system to send the money to my Health Equity HSA account. I've attached the banking info for said account. 
 
Do you think you can help? I feel like I'm 90% of the way there 
🙂
.
 
Happy to schedule a call to talk thru as well.
 
BTW, my thought is to make 2 giant deductions from my next 2 paychecks so that I can max it out this year & we don't have to look at this ever again...until next year 
🙂
.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

 Nicole Barile <

Hello Nicole,
Thank you for clarifying. I wouldn't be able to assist you with how to deduct those funds from your paycheck pretax as that is something your payroll team will need to assist you with. I will be able to help go over how to submit the contributions once they are deducted though.
Since you are wanting to use the routing and account numbers to submit those contributions, you will just give the routing and account numbers to your payroll company. They will then be able to submit the contributions as direct deposits to those routing and account numbers for you. There are a few things to note with submitting your contributions that way though.
The routing and account (PPD) numbers can be found on the employer portal under the reports. There is a quick link on the portal home page that says PPD Account Numbers. The first and most important thing to know about is that 
this page of the employer portal is 
not
 copy and paste compatible, copying and pasting from this page will scramble the numbers to make them incorrect
. Y
ou will want to use the export button at the top of the page to export the info to an excel spreadsheet if you intend to distribute the info to your payroll team. The second important thing to know about PPD contributions is that our system registers all direct deposit contributions as 
Employee Contributions
. So, if employer contributions are ever made, our system will track them as employee contributions only. 
If in the future, you decide to make contributions in a different way, you can also submit your pretax contributions through the Manage Money>HSA Contribution>Submit by Employee Listing page in the employer portal. The attached guide can help you set that up if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,
Cari S.
Client Services Consultant l
HealthEquity
O: 866-382-3510
employerservices@healthequity.com
At HealthEquity, we’re always looking for ways to create a positive client experience, so your feedback is essential. Based on your most recent email interaction, a very brief survey from 
CustomerExperience@feedback.healthequity.com
 may be presented, and we’d greatly appreciate hearing from you. Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have further questions or feel that this issue has not been fully resolved. It was a pleasure assisting you.
--------------- Original Message ---------------
From:
 Nicole Barile [n.barile@lcwmail.com]
Sent:
 2/24/2025, 6:53 AM
To:
 
employerservices@healthequity.com
Subject:
 Re: Questions about our company HSA - [ ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref ]
Hi Cari,
Thanks for this info. I think I did a bad job explaining what happened ?.
I'm not worried about fraud and don't want to close the card.
I was trying to add our Health Equity account to our HR system and was having trouble. But now I realize that's not what I need to do.
 
My goal is to deduct money from our payroll for an employee (me) to add to my Health Equity HSA account.
 
I have the Health Equity-generated routing # & bank account number for me.
What do we do next? How do we take the money out of my paycheck & put into my HSA. Is this managed in our Health Equity account, or do you know if we have to set it up in our HRIS system? 
I may need to call to explain better ?.
 
Thank you!
Nicole

 Re: Questions about our company HSA - [ ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref ]
 
 
Hello Nicole,
Thank you for contacting HealthEquity regarding your account. I hope this email finds you well.
I am reaching out to you regarding your HSA card. I am not familiar with TriNet (formerly Zenefits) and how they work, what I do know about payroll groups similar to them is that typically they will submit contributions to your HSAs routing and account numbers. So, they shouldn't need your card at all. I suggest reaching out to them to get some clarification as to why they would be sending you a card. I also suggest you log into your member portal and close the existing card to your account and order a replacement. That way your HSA is not vulnerable to card fraud. The person whose name is on the card (you) should be the only one who has access to that card for the security of the account. Please let me know if that does not help answer your questions. I am happy to continue investigating this issue with you if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,

body:

They did not pay the one from March 2024 because they historically do not pay invoices on time and they get lost with them so they need to followed up with and confirmed or they won’t be paid.
 
SG, can you reach out to our contact there in AP to make them aware we are closing books and can’t without these delayed payments we have not received. It looks like we should’ve at least gotten a portion, per Gaelle’s not but never did.

Subject:
 Re: [EXT] URGENT Past due LCW invoices
 
Hi there.
 
Can you please tell me why we submitted these invoices for expeenses so late? Was it just an accounting oversight, or did the consultant (Tamara) not submit these / notify accounting in time?
It looks like Inv #24014-EXP-B is for the session on Jan 11, 2024 ($159.57) & was sent to the client on 3/21/24 (invoice date)...about 2 months later... 
So why wouldn't they pay this one?
 
As for these 2, unfortunately, legally we cannot make them pay these (see legal notes below):
·
                  
Inv #17240362-EXP ($1,414.83) was sent on 4/10/24 for the session on May 17, 2023 - about 1 year later.
·
                  
Inv #17240123-EXP ($4,633) was sent on 4/10/24 for the session on October 1, 2022 - about 1.5 years later.
 
Richemont (Cartier) legal notes
From a Richemont PO: PAYMENTS - Unless otherwise provided in this order, invoices shall be settled within thirty (30) days of the date of the applicable invoice. Vendor shall be responsible for charging, collecting and remitting the appropriate sales, use and/or other applicable taxes, and such taxes shall be itemized on the applicable invoice within 30 days.
I see an unsigned Service Agreement with Cartier (Richemont) that states: Payment terms shall be specified in each Statement of Work. Our SOWs don't have specific language around late payments from our side.
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer

Hey there.... More HSA stuff 
🙂
.
 
It seems setting up the HSA through TriNet was not the correct route. I'm just going to ignore that (not bother to cancel) since we won't be using them much longer.
 
I've investigated on my own & think I understand what needs to be done.
 
I set up a new payroll deduction type in TriNet - HSA - pre-tax. I added it as a one-time payment instead of a % of salary.
 
If you go into Payroll & then to my name, you can add that new deduction type (HSA) and add the amount. See screenshot.
 
Here are more instructions: 
https://help.zenefits.com/Payroll/Payroll_App/Managing_Deductions__Contributions/How_do_I_add_a_one-time_deduction_or_contribution_to_employees_in_Payroll%3F?mt-view=f1
.
 
I haven't gone further, as I'm not 100% sure if this is correct.
Do you think it is?
 
What I don't know is how to tell the system to send the money to my Health Equity HSA account. I've attached the banking info for said account. 
 
Do you think you can help? I feel like I'm 90% of the way there 
🙂
.
 
Happy to schedule a call to talk thru as well.
 
BTW, my thought is to make 2 giant deductions from my next 2 paychecks so that I can max it out this year & we don't have to look at this ever again...until next year 
🙂
.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile

Hello Nicole,
Thank you for clarifying. I wouldn't be able to assist you with how to deduct those funds from your paycheck pretax as that is something your payroll team will need to assist you with. I will be able to help go over how to submit the contributions once they are deducted though.
Since you are wanting to use the routing and account numbers to submit those contributions, you will just give the routing and account numbers to your payroll company. They will then be able to submit the contributions as direct deposits to those routing and account numbers for you. There are a few things to note with submitting your contributions that way though.
The routing and account (PPD) numbers can be found on the employer portal under the reports. There is a quick link on the portal home page that says PPD Account Numbers. The first and most important thing to know about is that 
this page of the employer portal is 
not
 copy and paste compatible, copying and pasting from this page will scramble the numbers to make them incorrect
. Y
ou will want to use the export button at the top of the page to export the info to an excel spreadsheet if you intend to distribute the info to your payroll team. The second important thing to know about PPD contributions is that our system registers all direct deposit contributions as 
Employee Contributions
. So, if employer contributions are ever made, our system will track them as employee contributions only. 
If in the future, you decide to make contributions in a different way, you can also submit your pretax contributions through the Manage Money>HSA Contribution>Submit by Employee Listing page in the employer portal. The attached guide can help you set that up if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,
Cari S.
Client Services Consultant l
HealthEquity
O: 866-382-3510
employerservices@healthequity.com
At HealthEquity, we’re always looking for ways to create a positive client experience, so your feedback is essential. Based on your most recent email interaction, a very brief survey from 
CustomerExperience@feedback.healthequity.com
 may be presented, and we’d greatly appreciate hearing from you. Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have further questions or feel that this issue has not been fully resolved. It was a pleasure assisting you.

My goal is to deduct money from our payroll for an employee (me) to add to my Health Equity HSA account.
 
I have the Health Equity-generated routing # & bank account number for me.
What do we do next? How do we take the money out of my paycheck & put into my HSA. Is this managed in our Health Equity account, or do you know if we have to set it up in our HRIS system? 
I may need to call to explain better ?.

 Re: Questions about our company HSA - [ ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref ]
 
 
Hello Nicole,
Thank you for contacting HealthEquity regarding your account. I hope this email finds you well.
I am reaching out to you regarding your HSA card. I am not familiar with TriNet (formerly Zenefits) and how they work, what I do know about payroll groups similar to them is that typically they will submit contributions to your HSAs routing and account numbers. So, they shouldn't need your card at all. I suggest reaching out to them to get some clarification as to why they would be sending you a card. I also suggest you log into your member portal and close the existing card to your account and order a replacement. That way your HSA is not vulnerable to card fraud. The person whose name is on the card (you) should be the only one who has access to that card for the security of the account. Please let me know if that does not help answer your questions. I am happy to continue investigating this issue with you if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,
Cari S.
Client Services Consultant l
HealthEquity
O: 866-382-3510
employerservices@healthequity.com
At HealthEquity, we’re always looking for ways to create a positive client experience, so your feedback is essential. Based on your most recent email interaction, a very brief survey from 
CustomerExperience@feedback.healthequity.com
 may be presented, and we’d greatly appreciate hearing from you. Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have further questions or feel that this issue has not been fully resolved. It was a pleasure assisting you.
--------------- Original Message ---------------

 HQY Employer Services [employerservices@healthequity.com]
Sent:
 2/20/2025, 1:27 PM
To:
 
n.barile@lcwmail.com
Subject:
 Re: Questions about our company HSA - ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref
  
Hi NICOLE,
Thank you for contacting HealthEquity. This is an automated reply to notify you that your inquiry was just assigned to Cari who is currently looking into your request and will follow up soon. In the meantime, please feel free to use the resources and self-service options available on our website. If you need immediate assistance, please give us a call. 
Contact Us | HealthEquity®
For updates on this inquiry, please reply directly to this email or call the below phone number and include your case number: 55244820.
Cari Spencer

subject: Re: [EXT] URGENT Past due LCW invoices
body:
Hi there.
Can you please tell me why we submitted these invoices for expeenses so late? Was it just an accounting oversight, or did the consultant (Tamara) not submit these / notify accounting in time?
It looks like Inv #24014-EXP-B is for the session on Jan 11, 2024 ($159.57) & was sent to the client on 3/21/24 (invoice date)...about 2 months later... 
So why wouldn't they pay this one?
As for these 2, unfortunately, legally we cannot make them pay these (see legal notes below):
Inv #17240362-EXP ($1,414.83) was sent on 4/10/24 for the session on May 17, 2023 - about 1 year later.
Inv #17240123-EXP ($4,633) was sent on 4/10/24 for the session on October 1, 2022 - about 1.5 years later.
Richemont (Cartier) legal notes
From a Richemont PO: PAYMENTS - Unless otherwise provided in this order, invoices shall be settled within thirty (30) days of the date of the applicable invoice. Vendor shall be responsible for charging, collecting and remitting the appropriate sales, use and/or other applicable taxes, and such taxes shall be itemized on the applicable invoice within 30 days.
I see an unsigned Service Agreement with Cartier (Richemont) that states: Payment terms shall be specified in each Statement of Work. Our SOWs don't have specific language around late payments from our side.
Thanks!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

SG

I am so sorry, but while I am willing to make an exception for a 2023 invoice, the invoice dating back to 2022 is just too late as we have long closed the budget for that year and it would not be in compliance to process this. 
 
We also have tight budgets and have already allocated a large portion of our budget to LCW this year for our DEI efforts.     I would appreciate some partnership on this matter.

Hello Nicole,
Thank you for clarifying. I wouldn't be able to assist you with how to deduct those funds from your paycheck pretax as that is something your payroll team will need to assist you with. I will be able to help go over how to submit the contributions once they are deducted though.
Since you are wanting to use the routing and account numbers to submit those contributions, you will just give the routing and account numbers to your payroll company. They will then be able to submit the contributions as direct deposits to those routing and account numbers for you. There are a few things to note with submitting your contributions that way though.
The routing and account (PPD) numbers can be found on the employer portal under the reports. There is a quick link on the portal home page that says PPD Account Numbers. The first and most important thing to know about is that 
this page of the employer portal is 
not
 copy and paste compatible, copying and pasting from this page will scramble the numbers to make them incorrect
. Y
ou will want to use the export button at the top of the page to export the info to an excel spreadsheet if you intend to distribute the info to your payroll team. The second important thing to know about PPD contributions is that our system registers all direct deposit contributions as 
Employee Contributions
. So, if employer contributions are ever made, our system will track them as employee contributions only. 
If in the future, you decide to make contributions in a different way, you can also submit your pretax contributions through the Manage Money>HSA Contribution>Submit by Employee Listing page in the employer portal. The attached guide can help you set that up if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,

Hello Nicole,
Thank you for contacting HealthEquity regarding your account. I hope this email finds you well.
I am reaching out to you regarding your HSA card. I am not familiar with TriNet (formerly Zenefits) and how they work, what I do know about payroll groups similar to them is that typically they will submit contributions to your HSAs routing and account numbers. So, they shouldn't need your card at all. I suggest reaching out to them to get some clarification as to why they would be sending you a card. I also suggest you log into your member portal and close the existing card to your account and order a replacement. That way your HSA is not vulnerable to card fraud. The person whose name is on the card (you) should be the only one who has access to that card for the security of the account. Please let me know if that does not help answer your questions. I am happy to continue investigating this issue with you if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.

Thank you for contacting HealthEquity regarding your account. I hope this email finds you well.
I am reaching out to you regarding your HSA card. I am not familiar with TriNet (formerly Zenefits) and how they work, what I do know about payroll groups similar to them is that typically they will submit contributions to your HSAs routing and account numbers. So, they shouldn't need your card at all. I suggest reaching out to them to get some clarification as to why they would be sending you a card. I also suggest you log into your member portal and close the existing card to your account and order a replacement. That way your HSA is not vulnerable to card fraud. The person whose name is on the card (you) should be the only one who has access to that card for the security of the account. Please let me know if that does not help answer your questions. I am happy to continue investigating this issue with you if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,
Cari S.
Client Services Consultant l
HealthEquity
O: 866-382-3510
employerservices@healthequity.com
At HealthEquity, we’re always looking for ways to create a positive client experience, so your feedback is essential. Based on your most recent email interaction, a very brief survey from 
CustomerExperience@feedback.healthequity.com
 may be presented, and we’d greatly appreciate hearing from you. Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have further questions or feel that this issue has not been fully resolved. It was a pleasure assisting you.
--------------- Original Message ---------------

 HQY Employer Services [employerservices@healthequity.com]
Sent:
 2/20/2025, 1:27 PM
To:
 
n.barile@lcwmail.com
Subject:
 Re: Questions about our company HSA - ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref
  
Hi NICOLE,
Thank you for contacting HealthEquity. This is an automated reply to notify you that your inquiry was just assigned to Cari who is currently looking into your request and will follow up soon. In the meantime, please feel free to use the resources and self-service options available on our website. If you need immediate assistance, please give us a call. 
Contact Us | HealthEquity®
For updates on this inquiry, please reply directly to this email or call the below phone number and include your case number: 55244820.
Cari Spencer
Client Service Consultant I, Client Services
866.382.3510
Employerservices@healthequity.com

subject: GroupM Vendor Information Required
body:
Hello,
I hope this email finds you well. 
As part of our efforts to maintain up-to-date data and streamline our processes, we are following up on our request for updated information from our vendors.
When you get a chance, can you please take a moment to complete the request form that is linked below?
https://forms.microsoft.com/e/UEFPafLdJd
Please reach out if you have any questions.
Thank you in advance and we look forward to continuing our work together.
Thank you, 
SCOTT RIVKIN
Director, Procurement
— 
p: (212) 297-8181 | m: (301) 356-3687 
3 World Trade Center 
175 Greenwich Street 
New York, NY 10007

accounting@lcwmail.com
