 Re: Update on your payment from LCW
 
Good afternoon Sarah,
 
I did not get quickbooks alerts unfortunately!  
 
I did expect full payment by Monday at the latest as you indicated. 
 
 
Can you explain to me what installments amounts  we are talking about???  Dates over month of March would mean weekly then? 
 
 
I was gracious about a 2 weeks delay but now this will affect the end of my quarter expenses. 
 
 
Thanks for reaching out and letting me know. 
 
I plan to reach out to Alisa ( ok with you?) to express that a heads up would have been more professional as you did initially than this drastic change.  I understand LCW ‘s situation but I was and still am a team
player and do not feel valued nor appreciated. 
 
Not your fault but important for me to express!  
 
Thanks SG, I know you are doing an excellent job and that it’s a touch position to be in. 
 
If full about is paid by April 1st, I will face the circumstances. 
 
 
Kind regards,
 
 
Patricia 
 
On Feb 27, 2025, at 11:30
 
AM, Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
﻿
Hi Patricia – I’m sure you already got the email from QuickBooks, but wanted to let you know that we’ve processed a portion of your final payment from LCW. Alisa is trying to delay as many things as possible, so we’ve broken your payment into 3 installments that I plan to send over the next month.
 
Hope all is well! I miss having you around here 
❤
 
“SG” Gluckstein

Hi Alisa,
This should probably be a phone call, but I have run out of time today...
 
I have an email from Patricia Coleman regarding delayed or reduced payment to her. I assume this is related to your email yesterday regarding Tamara's payment. The problem with not paying Patricia (or Dustin) is that we are working with both of them right now. I need Patricia to do 3 trainings for me, and other consultants need her as well. If she doesn't get paid or we delay payments, she will not work with us, and frankly, we don't have the time to spend to replace her & find new people....or change the facilitator on the client.
 
Do you need a list from us of who we are currently working with or will be working with in the near future? Or, can we just agree to pay all consultants. We are actively working with these folks.
 
Happy to hop on a call tomorrow but wanted this sent to you asap as I need Patricia to confirm some trainings for me, and she doesn't want to.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile

subject: RE: Update on your payment from LCW
body:
Hi Patricia,
 
Thanks so much for reaching out – I’ve talked with Alisa and Nicole, and I processed the balance of your payment today. It will arrive next week.
 
Best,
SG
 
From:
 pcoleman azworldconnections.com <pcoleman@azworldconnections.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, February 27, 2025 11:44
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Update on your payment from LCW
 
Good afternoon Sarah, 
 
I did not get quickbooks alerts unfortunately!  
 
I did expect full payment by Monday at the latest as you indicated. 
 
 
Can you explain to me what installments amounts  we are talking about???  Dates over month of March would mean weekly then? 
 
 
I was gracious about a 2 weeks delay but now this will affect the end of my quarter expenses. 
 
 
Thanks for reaching out and letting me know. 
 
I plan to reach out to Alisa ( ok with you?) to express that a heads up would have been more professional as you did initially than this drastic change.  I understand LCW ‘s situation but I was and still am a team
player and do not feel valued nor appreciated. 
 
Not your fault but important for me to express!  
 
Thanks SG, I know you are doing an excellent job and that it’s a touch position to be in. 
 
If full about is paid by April 1st, I will face the circumstances. 
 
 
Kind regards,
 
 
Patricia 
On Feb 27, 2025, at 11:30
 
AM, Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
﻿
 
Hi Patricia – I’m sure you already got the email from QuickBooks, but wanted to let you know that we’ve processed a portion of your final payment from LCW. Alisa is trying to delay as many things as possible, so we’ve broken your payment into 3 installments that I plan to send over the next month.
 
Hope all is well! I miss having you around here 
❤
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW

subject: RE: Payments to vendors - Patricia
body:
Hi Nicole – I just processed the balance of what we owe Patricia.
 
Maybe for the PPF going forward, I can run it by you before going to Alisa for final approval, and you can let me know if anyone on it is someone we’re not in a current working relationship with?
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, February 27, 2025 16:47
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Fw: Payments to vendors - Patricia
 
Hi. Please pay Patricia in full - see below. LMK if you have any questions.
Alisa said it would be helpful to know when you pay folks who we are currently working with. That's a bit tricky, but really anyone on your list is someone we are currently working with. This should include Patricia, Tatyana, Hanadi, Larry, and some new upcoming folks - Yuri, Diya, Yuko... Really any consultant.
Not sure if I can get this to you... It might be easier to just tell you when we are NOT working with someone. But most of these folks are ongoing.... (Sorry...I'm typing my thoughts, sorry if confusing) 
🙂
 
Nicole Barile

Hey Nicole,  I talked to SG yesterday and asked if we could split Patricia's payment, she said that shouldn't be a problem. I did not know she was still working with us. If she is, it is fine to pay her the full amount. I told SG to pay Dustin for this PPF because I know you hadn't talked to him yet and now that I know he is still working on things for us, I'm fine with you handling it how you need to, to ensure we finish the work.
 
Feel free to call with any questions.
 
Alisa

From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Thursday, 27 February 2025 16:29:28
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Payments to vendors
 
 
Hi Alisa,
This should probably be a phone call, but I have run out of time today...
 
I have an email from Patricia Coleman regarding delayed or reduced payment to her. I assume this is related to your email yesterday regarding Tamara's payment. The problem with not paying Patricia (or Dustin) is that we are working with both of them right now. I need Patricia to do 3 trainings for me, and other consultants need her as well. If she doesn't get paid or we delay payments, she will not work with us, and frankly, we don't have the time to spend to replace her & find new people....or change the facilitator on the client.
 
Do you need a list from us of who we are currently working with or will be working with in the near future? Or, can we just agree to pay all consultants. We are actively working with these folks.
 
Happy to hop on a call tomorrow but wanted this sent to you asap as I need Patricia to confirm some trainings for me, and she doesn't want to.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)

body:
Hi SG!
I finally have the "final" answer on what to do with my HSA.
I will add the HSA deduction in TriNet to the draft payroll run for Feb.15-Mar.1. When I enter this amount, TriNet calculates & adjust the taxes accordingly.
Then when you / Alisa go to pay payroll, you would take the HSA deduction amount I've designated in TriNet (I'll set it for a flat $1k to be easy) & send it to my Health Equity account via ACH - info attached.
Copying Alisa for awareness.
Do you have any questions or need more info?
Thanks so much!
Nicole Barile

Hey there.... More HSA stuff 
🙂
.
 
It seems setting up the HSA through TriNet was not the correct route. I'm just going to ignore that (not bother to cancel) since we won't be using them much longer.
 
I've investigated on my own & think I understand what needs to be done.
 
I set up a new payroll deduction type in TriNet - HSA - pre-tax. I added it as a one-time payment instead of a % of salary.
 
If you go into Payroll & then to my name, you can add that new deduction type (HSA) and add the amount. See screenshot.
 
Here are more instructions: 
https://help.zenefits.com/Payroll/Payroll_App/Managing_Deductions__Contributions/How_do_I_add_a_one-time_deduction_or_contribution_to_employees_in_Payroll%3F?mt-view=f1
.
 
I haven't gone further, as I'm not 100% sure if this is correct.
Do you think it is?
 
What I don't know is how to tell the system to send the money to my Health Equity HSA account. I've attached the banking info for said account. 
 
Do you think you can help? I feel like I'm 90% of the way there 
🙂
.
 
Happy to schedule a call to talk thru as well.
 
BTW, my thought is to make 2 giant deductions from my next 2 paychecks so that I can max it out this year & we don't have to look at this ever again...until next year 
🙂
.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile

>

 Monday, February 24, 2025 3:40 PM

 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Questions about our company HSA - [ ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref ]
 
 
Hello Nicole,
Thank you for clarifying. I wouldn't be able to assist you with how to deduct those funds from your paycheck pretax as that is something your payroll team will need to assist you with. I will be able to help go over how to submit the contributions once they are deducted though.
Since you are wanting to use the routing and account numbers to submit those contributions, you will just give the routing and account numbers to your payroll company. They will then be able to submit the contributions as direct deposits to those routing and account numbers for you. There are a few things to note with submitting your contributions that way though.
The routing and account (PPD) numbers can be found on the employer portal under the reports. There is a quick link on the portal home page that says PPD Account Numbers. The first and most important thing to know about is that 
this page of the employer portal is 
not
 copy and paste compatible, copying and pasting from this page will scramble the numbers to make them incorrect
. Y
ou will want to use the export button at the top of the page to export the info to an excel spreadsheet if you intend to distribute the info to your payroll team. The second important thing to know about PPD contributions is that our system registers all direct deposit contributions as 
Employee Contributions
. So, if employer contributions are ever made, our system will track them as employee contributions only. 
If in the future, you decide to make contributions in a different way, you can also submit your pretax contributions through the Manage Money>HSA Contribution>Submit by Employee Listing page in the employer portal. The attached guide can help you set that up if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,
Cari S.
Client Services Consultant l
HealthEquity
O: 866-382-3510
employerservices@healthequity.com

CustomerExperience@feedback.healthequity.com
 may be presented, and we’d greatly appreciate hearing from you. Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have further questions or feel that this issue has not been fully resolved. It was a pleasure assisting you.

Hi Cari,
Thanks for this info. I think I did a bad job explaining what happened ?.
I'm not worried about fraud and don't want to close the card.
I was trying to add our Health Equity account to our HR system and was having trouble. But now I realize that's not what I need to do.
 
My goal is to deduct money from our payroll for an employee (me) to add to my Health Equity HSA account.
 
I have the Health Equity-generated routing # & bank account number for me.
What do we do next? How do we take the money out of my paycheck & put into my HSA. Is this managed in our Health Equity account, or do you know if we have to set it up in our HRIS system? 
I may need to call to explain better ?.
 
Thank you!
Nicole

Hello Nicole,
Thank you for contacting HealthEquity regarding your account. I hope this email finds you well.
I am reaching out to you regarding your HSA card. I am not familiar with TriNet (formerly Zenefits) and how they work, what I do know about payroll groups similar to them is that typically they will submit contributions to your HSAs routing and account numbers. So, they shouldn't need your card at all. I suggest reaching out to them to get some clarification as to why they would be sending you a card. I also suggest you log into your member portal and close the existing card to your account and order a replacement. That way your HSA is not vulnerable to card fraud. The person whose name is on the card (you) should be the only one who has access to that card for the security of the account. Please let me know if that does not help answer your questions. I am happy to continue investigating this issue with you if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.

 Re: Questions about our company HSA - [ ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref ]
 
 
Hello Nicole,
Thank you for clarifying. I wouldn't be able to assist you with how to deduct those funds from your paycheck pretax as that is something your payroll team will need to assist you with. I will be able to help go over how to submit the contributions once they are deducted though.
Since you are wanting to use the routing and account numbers to submit those contributions, you will just give the routing and account numbers to your payroll company. They will then be able to submit the contributions as direct deposits to those routing and account numbers for you. There are a few things to note with submitting your contributions that way though.
The routing and account (PPD) numbers can be found on the employer portal under the reports. There is a quick link on the portal home page that says PPD Account Numbers. The first and most important thing to know about is that 
this page of the employer portal is 
not
 copy and paste compatible, copying and pasting from this page will scramble the numbers to make them incorrect
. Y
ou will want to use the export button at the top of the page to export the info to an excel spreadsheet if you intend to distribute the info to your payroll team. The second important thing to know about PPD contributions is that our system registers all direct deposit contributions as 
Employee Contributions
. So, if employer contributions are ever made, our system will track them as employee contributions only. 
If in the future, you decide to make contributions in a different way, you can also submit your pretax contributions through the Manage Money>HSA Contribution>Submit by Employee Listing page in the employer portal. The attached guide can help you set that up if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,
Cari S.

HealthEquity

subject: Re: Update on your payment from LCW
body:
Good afternoon Sarah, 
I did not get quickbooks alerts unfortunately!  
I did expect full payment by Monday at the latest as you indicated. 
Can you explain to me what installments amounts  we are talking about???  Dates over month of March would mean weekly then? 
I was gracious about a 2 weeks delay but now this will affect the end of my quarter expenses. 
Thanks for reaching out and letting me know. 
I plan to reach out to Alisa ( ok with you?) to express that a heads up would have been more professional as you did initially than this drastic change.  I understand LCW ‘s situation but I was and still am a team
player and do not feel valued nor appreciated. 
Not your fault but important for me to express!  
Thanks SG, I know you are doing an excellent job and that it’s a touch position to be in. 
If full about is paid by April 1st, I will face the circumstances. 
Kind regards,
Patricia

body:
Hey Nicole,
I have no idea what’s the correct way to do this – I would call Zenefits and see what they say. It’s super important that the money gets paid through the correct official channels to avoid any IRS issues.
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 25, 2025 13:44
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Fw: Questions about our company HSA - [ ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref ]
 
Hey there.... More HSA stuff 
🙂
.
 
It seems setting up the HSA through TriNet was not the correct route. I'm just going to ignore that (not bother to cancel) since we won't be using them much longer.
 
I've investigated on my own & think I understand what needs to be done.
 
I set up a new payroll deduction type in TriNet - HSA - pre-tax. I added it as a one-time payment instead of a % of salary.
 
If you go into Payroll & then to my name, you can add that new deduction type (HSA) and add the amount. See screenshot.
 
Here are more instructions: 
https://help.zenefits.com/Payroll/Payroll_App/Managing_Deductions__Contributions/How_do_I_add_a_one-time_deduction_or_contribution_to_employees_in_Payroll%3F?mt-view=f1
.
 
I haven't gone further, as I'm not 100% sure if this is correct.
Do you think it is?
 
What I don't know is how to tell the system to send the money to my Health Equity HSA account. I've attached the banking info for said account. 
 
Do you think you can help? I feel like I'm 90% of the way there 
🙂
.
 
Happy to schedule a call to talk thru as well.
 
BTW, my thought is to make 2 giant deductions from my next 2 paychecks so that I can max it out this year & we don't have to look at this ever again...until next year 
🙂
.
 
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile

LCW

Hi Tamara,
 
Thanks for your patience on this, I’m sure you know how busy we’ve been.
 
Chuck and I reviewed our records, and we agree that based on your contract we do still owe you this payment of $3,250. It looks like we had only received 3 invoices from you, which is why that’s all that was paid in 2024, but I’ve set this one up manually and we’ll process as soon as we’re able.
 
Would it be ok with you if it’s broken into a few installments so that it helps our cash flows?
 
Also, I’m sending you an invitation from QuickBooks Money to set up your bank account for direct deposit. Let me know if you have any issues or would prefer that I enter the data manually.

subject: Fw: Questions about our company HSA -     [ ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref ]
body:
Hey there.... More HSA stuff 🙂.
It seems setting up the HSA through TriNet was not the correct route. I'm just going to ignore that (not bother to cancel) since we won't be using them much longer.
I've investigated on my own & think I understand what needs to be done.
I set up a new payroll deduction type in TriNet - HSA - pre-tax. I added it as a one-time payment instead of a % of salary.
If you go into Payroll & then to my name, you can add that new deduction type (HSA) and add the amount. See screenshot.
Here are more instructions: 
https://help.zenefits.com/Payroll/Payroll_App/Managing_Deductions__Contributions/How_do_I_add_a_one-time_deduction_or_contribution_to_employees_in_Payroll%3F?mt-view=f1
.
I haven't gone further, as I'm not 100% sure if this is correct.
Do you think it is?
What I don't know is how to tell the system to send the money to my Health Equity HSA account. I've attached the banking info for said account. 
Do you think you can help? I feel like I'm 90% of the way there 🙂.
Happy to schedule a call to talk thru as well.
BTW, my thought is to make 2 giant deductions from my next 2 paychecks so that I can max it out this year & we don't have to look at this ever again...until next year 🙂.
Thanks!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

From:
 CS Email <employerservices@healthequity.com>
Sent:
 Monday, February 24, 2025 3:40 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Questions about our company HSA - [ ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref ]
 
 
Hello Nicole,
Thank you for clarifying. I wouldn't be able to assist you with how to deduct those funds from your paycheck pretax as that is something your payroll team will need to assist you with. I will be able to help go over how to submit the contributions once they are deducted though.
Since you are wanting to use the routing and account numbers to submit those contributions, you will just give the routing and account numbers to your payroll company. They will then be able to submit the contributions as direct deposits to those routing and account numbers for you. There are a few things to note with submitting your contributions that way though.
The routing and account (PPD) numbers can be found on the employer portal under the reports. There is a quick link on the portal home page that says PPD Account Numbers. The first and most important thing to know about is that 
this page of the employer portal is 
not
 copy and paste compatible, copying and pasting from this page will scramble the numbers to make them incorrect
. Y
ou will want to use the export button at the top of the page to export the info to an excel spreadsheet if you intend to distribute the info to your payroll team. The second important thing to know about PPD contributions is that our system registers all direct deposit contributions as 
Employee Contributions
. So, if employer contributions are ever made, our system will track them as employee contributions only. 
If in the future, you decide to make contributions in a different way, you can also submit your pretax contributions through the Manage Money>HSA Contribution>Submit by Employee Listing page in the employer portal. The attached guide can help you set that up if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,
Cari S.
Client Services Consultant l
HealthEquity
O: 866-382-3510
employerservices@healthequity.com

Based on your most recent email interaction, a very brief survey from CustomerExperience@feedback.healthequity.com may be presented, and we’d greatly appreciate hearing from you. Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have further questions or feel that this issue has not been fully resolved. It was a pleasure assisting you.

From:
 Nicole Barile [n.barile@lcwmail.com]
Sent:
 2/24/2025, 6:53 AM
To:
 employerservices@healthequity.com
Subject:
 Re: Questions about our company HSA - [ ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref ]
Hi Cari,
Thanks for this info. I think I did a bad job explaining what happened ?.
I'm not worried about fraud and don't want to close the card.
I was trying to add our Health Equity account to our HR system and was having trouble. But now I realize that's not what I need to do.
 
My goal is to deduct money from our payroll for an employee (me) to add to my Health Equity HSA account.
 
I have the Health Equity-generated routing # & bank account number for me.
What do we do next? How do we take the money out of my paycheck & put into my HSA. Is this managed in our Health Equity account, or do you know if we have to set it up in our HRIS system? 
I may need to call to explain better ?.
 
Thank you!
Nicole
 
 
Nicole Barile

LCW

From:

Sent:
 Friday, February 21, 2025 3:10 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Questions about our company HSA - [ ref:!00D300ESC.!5006Q02RM4nO:ref ]
 
 
Hello Nicole,
Thank you for contacting HealthEquity regarding your account. I hope this email finds you well.
I am reaching out to you regarding your HSA card. I am not familiar with TriNet (formerly Zenefits) and how they work, what I do know about payroll groups similar to them is that typically they will submit contributions to your HSAs routing and account numbers. So, they shouldn't need your card at all. I suggest reaching out to them to get some clarification as to why they would be sending you a card. I also suggest you log into your member portal and close the existing card to your account and order a replacement. That way your HSA is not vulnerable to card fraud. The person whose name is on the card (you) should be the only one who has access to that card for the security of the account. Please let me know if that does not help answer your questions. I am happy to continue investigating this issue with you if needed.
If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact HealthEquity at 866-382-3510 or via Chat in the employer portal.
We are available to assist you Monday through Friday, 7AM - 7PM CST.
Thank you,

I know this is not a great situation to be in but the current state of LCW and what is happening with DEI, I am making a choice to prioritize existing employees and critical expenses over non critical or third-party contracts. Let’s revisit when our cashflow is positive. 
 
Nicole, do you feel comfortable sending an email, if not I’ll send it?

subject: Annual Refiling Survey - PASSWORD
body:
Dear Employer,
To complete the Annual Refiling Survey (ARS) online, please use the WEBID(s) from the email you recently received with the subject line: 'Annual Refiling Survey Notice', along with your password(s) below to log on to our secure website: 
https://idcfars.bls.gov/
 
PASSWORD 1: 
Qo593523
PASSWORD 2: 
Ts365767
PASSWORD 3: 
Sz493312
PASSWORD 4: 
Sj143866
If you copy and paste the password, please ensure that you are only copying the 8 character password and no spaces before or after. 
If you cannot locate the Annual Refiling Survey Notice email in your inbox or SPAM folder, you can submit a request to have your survey notice resent: 
https://data.bls.gov/cgi-bin/forms/ars?/respondents/ars/home.htm
 
Additional information regarding this survey can be found at: 
https://www.bls.gov/respondents/ars
 
Thank you,
U.S. Department of Labor
Bureau of Labor Statistics
How do I know this email is from the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics? 
Links in this email will start with https:// and contain 'bls.gov.' Your browser will display a padlock or tune icon to let you know connection to a site is secure. You can also type the address directly into your browser window.
The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) is committed to the responsible treatment of confidential information and takes rigorous security measures to protect confidential information in its possession. This email contains confidential information. If you believe you are not the intended recipient of this message, please notify the sender and delete this email without disclosing, copying, or further disseminating its contents.

subject: RESPONSE OVERDUE - Annual Refiling Survey Notice
body:
Dear Employer,
Every three years your State Workforce Agency and the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) ask that you verify your firm's address and main business activity through the Annual Refiling Survey (ARS). 
Unfortunately, we have not yet received a response from your firm.
 
Please log on to our secure website to complete your report: 
https://idcfars.bls.gov/
 
WEBID 1: 
340425318187
WEBID 2: 
270425267996
WEBID 3: 
390425372414
WEBID 4: 
410425401333
PASSWORD:
 Your 8-character password has been sent in a separate email. If you cannot find the password email in your inbox or SPAM folder, please go to our secure website and click on 
Forgot Password
. You will receive an email, at this same email address, with instructions for resetting your password online. 
Your email address was obtained from your State Unemployment Insurance (UI) filing, or because you filed this report online in a previous collection. 
Contacting businesses through email reduces printing and postage costs, saving tax dollars. If we do not hear from you, we will need to contact you again by printing and mailing a survey request. 
The ARS is authorized by 29 U.S. Code, Section 2. Your cooperation is needed to make the results of this survey complete, accurate, and timely. The Industry Verification Form, BLS-3023 is approved with O.M.B. No. 1220-0032, in cooperation with the U.S. Department of Labor. The information collected will be used for statistical and Unemployment Insurance program purposes and other purposes in accordance with law. Additional information regarding this survey can be found at: 
https://www.bls.gov/respondents/ars
 
Thank you,
U.S. Department of Labor
Bureau of Labor Statistics
How do I know this email is from the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics? 
Links in this email will start with https:// and contain 'bls.gov.' Your browser will display a padlock or tune icon to let you know connection to a site is secure. You can also type the address directly into your browser window.
The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) is committed to the responsible treatment of confidential information and takes rigorous security measures to protect confidential information in its possession. This email contains confidential information. If you believe you are not the intended recipient of this message, please notify the sender and delete this email without disclosing, copying, or further disseminating its contents.

subject: RE: [SUSPICIOUS MESSAGE] RE: Please review: Draft 1099
body:
Until our income is above our expenses, we will not pay expenses that don’t impact our day-to-day operations. I know this is not a great situation to be in but the current state of LCW and what is happening with DEI, I am making a choice to prioritize existing employees and critical expenses over non critical or third-party contracts. Let’s revisit when our cashflow is positive. 
 
Nicole, do you feel comfortable sending an email, if not I’ll send it?
 
Alisa Kolodizner

subject: RE: Your timesheet & Payment
body:
Hi Kaitlyn,
You’ll fill out the time sheet through the 28
th
, and send to Nicole within a week after that – doesn’t have to be the same day. Just know that if it’s significantly delayed it might not make it in time for the payment run so it would wait until the next one (two-ish weeks later)
 
SG
 
From:
 Kaitlyn Gocan <kaitlyn.gocan@gmail.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, February 24, 2025 14:24
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Your timesheet & Payment
 
Hi SG,
 
Thanks so much for the warm welcome and for sending these documents over.
 
Wanted to clarify, when should time sheets be sent for approval each month? For example, for this month, do I have until February 28th EOD to send to Nicole?
 
Best,
Kaitlyn Gocan
 
On Fri, Feb 21, 2025 at 12:31
 
PM Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hi there, Kaitlin!
 
I’ve attached the time sheet for first quarter 2025; I’ll send out a new one for Q2 at the end of March. Filling it out should be self-evident, but let me know if you have questions. Twice a month you’ll email a copy to Nicole for approval, and then she’ll send to me for processing. Pay is processed at the end of the next period (So for work done March 1-15, you’ll be paid March 31).
 
I’m going to send you an invitation from QuickBooks Money to set up an account and connect with LCW so you can provide your bank details for payment. Let me know if you run into any problems or would prefer I set you up manually.
 
Welcome to the team!
 
“SG” Gluckstein

subject: AJNJAA52000285501L - Johnson & Johnson for LANGUAGE AND CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
body:
Dear Valued Supplier,
We are requesting a current Accounts Receivable statement that includes all accounts and locations that Johnson & Johnson Services, Inc. has with your company. This request is part of a comprehensive review of our Accounts Payable transactions, conducted in conjunction with Apex Analytix.
 
A complete statement should include all open invoices, credits, rebates, unapplied cash, prepayments on account, overpayments, duplicate payments, and aged deposits.
 
Please note that this is a special request, and we kindly ask that you do not send copies of open invoices or update any address or contact information you currently have for submitting invoices and related documents. If you require assistance, you may visit our vendor portal at 
www.ap.jnj.com
.
 
Include any accounts related to these Johnson and Johnson companies:
 
Acclarent, Inc.

subject: Aflac ACH Payment Notification
body:
Please review the attachment for detailed payment information.
**********REMINDER******** 
How to Submit Invoices 
Invoices should be submitted only after you've provided goods or services to Aflac via email as an attachment to 
APInvoices@aflac.com
 
(This email address is for invoice submission only). 
Please be sure to: 
Attach a copy of your invoice to the email. PDF is the preferred invoice format.
Submit only one invoice per email. Emails containing multiple invoices will be returned for re-submission as single requests.
Email your invoice to 
APInvoices@aflac.com
 
(This email address is for invoice submission only)
.
**If you were issued a 10-digit Aflac Purchase Order Number, be sure to include it on each invoice you submit. Failure to do so will result in a returned invoice. As a reminder, Aflac Purchase Order Numbers are numeric-only and begin with 45. 
Please note if you are enrolled in the Ariba network, invoices must be submitted via the Ariba network. 
Thank you for doing business with Aflac!
Aflac Accounts Payable Department

subject: Re: Your timesheet & Payment
body:
Hi SG,
Thanks so much for the warm welcome and for sending these documents over.
Wanted to clarify, when should time sheets be sent for approval each month? For example, for this month, do I have until February 28th EOD to send to Nicole?
Best,
Kaitlyn Gocan
On Fri, Feb 21, 2025 at 12:31 PM Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hi there, Kaitlin!
 
I’ve attached the time sheet for first quarter 2025; I’ll send out a new one for Q2 at the end of March. Filling it out should be self-evident, but let me know if you have questions. Twice a month you’ll email a copy to Nicole for approval, and then she’ll send to me for processing. Pay is processed at the end of the next period (So for work done March 1-15, you’ll be paid March 31).
 
I’m going to send you an invitation from QuickBooks Money to set up an account and connect with LCW so you can provide your bank details for payment. Let me know if you run into any problems or would prefer I set you up manually.
 
Welcome to the team!
 
“SG” Gluckstein

body:
Sounds good. I will also put my head together with my other client who uses QB Payroll (and switched to it at the beginning of year), maybe she can give me some pointers to help us start the service later and save a month – If I can do it in the first week of April that would be ideal. I’m meeting with her next week so I’ll bring it up then.
 
SG

 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Friday, February 21, 2025 13:07
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: QBO Payroll
 
OK thanks SG.
 
At least QBO Payroll will be less expensive. I'll work with you if needed to get any historical data out of TriNet.
 
I assume there might be some instructions we'll need to share with FTEs at some point on using QBO to access paystubs, for ex...we have time on that & I can look into. I will give them a heads up.
 
Thanks for this!
 
 
Nicole Barile

>; Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>; Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: QBO Payroll
 
 
Thanks Nicole! Starting the first week of March I will set us up for QuickBooks Payroll, and begin the process of porting employees to the new system. My goal is that the mid-April payroll run will be the last on TriNet and we’ll use QuickBooks for May 1.
 
We will be paying for both systems for up to two months, in order to have the necessary overlap time (though QB will be billed to me, so a bit delayed coming to you). The timing is unfortunate with my travel in April but we’ll make it work.
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, February 20, 2025 15:48
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: QBO Payroll
 
Hi again!
I received this from TriNet:
 
"If no action is taken by April 30, 2025, your company’s month-to-month subscription will end, and employees will be offboarded from TriNet completely as of May 1, 2025."
 
So, this is the official go-ahead to move to QBO instead.
 
Thanks so much!
Nicole
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

😊
 We would start paying immediately so that we have both active during the switchover period (and it would be billed to my firm first, then passed through to LCW). My recommendation would be to start up with QB on March 1 so that I have all of March to get things set up before I’m traveling in April.
 
Can you confirm for me the date that our current Zenefits contract ends?
 
SG

https://quickbooks.intuit.com/payroll/pricing/bundle/
 
To get the ball rolling, is this something you are able to do, or do you need my or Alisa's help?
Thanks!
 
Nicole Barile

From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Friday, February 21, 2025 12:30 PM
To:
 Kaitlyn Gocan <kaitlyn.gocan@gmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Your timesheet & Payment
 
 
Hi there, Kaitlin!
 
I’ve attached the time sheet for first quarter 2025; I’ll send out a new one for Q2 at the end of March. Filling it out should be self-evident, but let me know if you have questions. Twice a month you’ll email a copy to Nicole for approval, and then she’ll send to me for processing. Pay is processed at the end of the next period (So for work done March 1-15, you’ll be paid March 31).
 
I’m going to send you an invitation from QuickBooks Money to set up an account and connect with LCW so you can provide your bank details for payment. Let me know if you run into any problems or would prefer I set you up manually.
 
Welcome to the team!
 
“SG” Gluckstein

subject: RE: Your timesheet & Payment
body:
Hi there, Kaitlin!
 
I’ve attached the time sheet for first quarter 2025; I’ll send out a new one for Q2 at the end of March. Filling it out should be self-evident, but let me know if you have questions. Twice a month you’ll email a copy to Nicole for approval, and then she’ll send to me for processing. Pay is processed at the end of the next period (So for work done March 1-15, you’ll be paid March 31).
 
I’m going to send you an invitation from QuickBooks Money to set up an account and connect with LCW so you can provide your bank details for payment. Let me know if you run into any problems or would prefer I set you up manually.
 
Welcome to the team!
 
“SG” Gluckstein

subject: RE: QBO Payroll
body:
Thanks Nicole! Starting the first week of March I will set us up for QuickBooks Payroll, and begin the process of porting employees to the new system. My goal is that the mid-April payroll run will be the last on TriNet and we’ll use QuickBooks for May 1.
 
We will be paying for both systems for up to two months, in order to have the necessary overlap time (though QB will be billed to me, so a bit delayed coming to you). The timing is unfortunate with my travel in April but we’ll make it work.
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, February 20, 2025 15:48
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: QBO Payroll
 
Hi again!
I received this from TriNet:
 
"If no action is taken by April 30, 2025, your company’s month-to-month subscription will end, and employees will be offboarded from TriNet completely as of May 1, 2025."
 
So, this is the official go-ahead to move to QBO instead.
 
Thanks so much!
Nicole
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

>

I can get the service started, with official approval 
😊
 We would start paying immediately so that we have both active during the switchover period (and it would be billed to my firm first, then passed through to LCW). My recommendation would be to start up with QB on March 1 so that I have all of March to get things set up before I’m traveling in April.
 
Can you confirm for me the date that our current Zenefits contract ends?
 
SG

https://quickbooks.intuit.com/payroll/pricing/bundle/
 
To get the ball rolling, is this something you are able to do, or do you need my or Alisa's help?
Thanks!
 
Nicole Barile

subject: RE: Please review: Draft 1099
body:
Hi Tamara,
 
Thanks for your patience on this, I’m sure you know how busy we’ve been.
 
Chuck and I reviewed our records, and we agree that based on your contract we do still owe you this payment of $3,250. It looks like we had only received 3 invoices from you, which is why that’s all that was paid in 2024, but I’ve set this one up manually and we’ll process as soon as we’re able.
 
Would it be ok with you if it’s broken into a few installments so that it helps our cash flows?
 
Also, I’m sending you an invitation from QuickBooks Money to set up your bank account for direct deposit. Let me know if you have any issues or would prefer that I enter the data manually.
 
Best,
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW

Thank you for sending over the 1099; I have identified two errors and more more significant. Based upon this 1099, I only received 3 payments and I should have received four.  My contract with LCW was $6,500/month for March and April. Hey Nicole – no problem at all. I can send her the blank time sheet, and then she will just need to send you (and you forward to me) the whole thing, or at least let me know how many hours.
 
Let me know her email and I’ll get her set up!
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 19, 2025 08:43
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 New PT person - Kaitlyn
 
Hi SG,
 
We have a new PT person who will be assisting Chuck & me with some admin tasks (related to sales & marketing) - Kaitlyn. She may only do 5 hours a week or so - we're not sure yet. $15/hr.
 
I know we have our Dropbox process for timesheets, but we are thinking of 
not
 getting her an LCW email or Dropbox account. If we don't get those things, would it be a pain for you to manage her timesheet? Would it be a problem to use a different process for her?
 
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Misc. stuff
 
 
Hey! 
 
Friday I taught a really fun Galentine's Day salsa/bachata class to a group of ladies. Then it went downhill from there...I caught a Cold/virus that's been going around here. Then all of Kentucky had a major flood on Saturday and woke up to snow on Sunday morning! So I guess you can say it was eventful. 
🙃
 
 
Calendly:
The subscription is canceled. Now we are using a free plan, and the previous subscription ended on February 7th. The last charge should have been on January 7
th
 (see invoice attached).
 
Scribe:
Scribe subscription is canceled. We are using the basic free plan. 
 
Webinar:
I don't have anything scheduled for later in the day on Wednesday. Around what time would you like to send it? I can then check my email and register everyone. 
 
-Kaitlin
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 18, 2025 1:56 PM
To:
 Kaitlin Nonweiler <
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Misc. stuff
 
 
Hey Kaitlin,
How was your weekend? Anything fun?
 
It was a cold & snowy one here in Cleveland.
 
Just a few things...
Did you cancel Calendly for the 5 or so folks using it?
Did you cancel Scribe?
I see charges on our account for these, but it could be the last charge.
 
Also, a reminder that our next webinar with Chuck & Andrea is this Thurs. I plan on sending you the registration list all at once late on Wed so you can register everyone. Is there a cut off time for you? Meaning, if I'd like you to register everyone on Wed, when's the latest time I can get you the registration list from HubSpot?
 
Thanks!
 
 
Nicole Barile

subject: Re: Payment info for your invoice #449
body:
Hi SG, 
Thank you for pointing me in the right direction. 
I created an account and processed the invoice through Quickbooks. Kindly send the payment to my bank. 
Please let me know if what you received looks good. Ii wasn't very sure what I was doing. 
Thanks again
Hanadi 
On Mon, Feb 17, 2025 at 12:13 PM Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hi Hanadi,
 
We have changed our bill pay processor, so I am going to send you an invitation to join QuickBooks Money for free so that you can manage your own payment details, as well as get timing details and receive your 1099 electronically at year end. If you prefer not to sign up directly, please let me know and I can enter the necessary data manually.
 
Thanks,
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW

Sent:
 Tuesday, February 18, 2025 1:20 PM
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 FW: Important update regarding international payments
 
 
Hi team – just got this email from Melio, who we use for international wires. FYI in case they don’t restore the service and we hit up against some vendor payment problems. I’ll keep you updated on any developments.
 
SG
 
From:
 The Melio Team <info@melio.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 18, 2025 09:07
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Important update regarding international payments
 
We are switching to a new payments provider, affecting international payments. 
͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏
 
Hi LCW,
We're making some updates to our systems, as we obtain state money transmission licenses. To facilitate these updates, we're moving to a new international payments provider. 
That means starting March 3rd, 2025, we'll be temporarily pausing international payments. After that, you won't be able to send payments to international vendors through Melio. Any payment scheduled for or after March 3rd, 2025, will not be processed. 
We understand this may impact you business, and we're working hard to restore this service as quickly as possible. We'll notify you as soon as international payments are back. 
We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. 
The Melio Team. 
​
 
 
 
 
 
This email was sent to you by Melio Payments Inc.
124 East 14th St., New York, NY 10003

Hi Chuck, 
 
After regrouping internally, we wanted to see if it would be possible to update the SOW to include the recording for 
Spotlight on the African American Community
 only. At the end of February, we can reevaluate adding recordings for the remaining four sessions based on the number of replays from BHM. The 2,000 audience size figure was an educated estimate, and we’d appreciate the opportunity to measure replays to provide a more accurate number.
 
We also understand that the 50% discount was contingent upon purchasing five courses. In good faith, we were hoping you might consider honoring the discount for BHM with the understanding that we plan to purchase the additional four courses once we have a better sense of replay engagement.
 
For BHM, we’d like to schedule the session for the first week of February and can coordinate specific dates based on mutual availability.
 
Lastly, please let us know who your accounting contact is so we can start getting LCW set up with EVED, our payment platform. 
 
Thank you very much for your consideration. We look forward to hearing your thoughts.
 
Jenny

Subject:
 Re: [External]LCW & Gap Follow up: Spotlight Previews
 
Hi Pedro, 
 
This is great, thank you for sending. Below I’ve outlined a few follow-up questions + notes around what we’d like to explore adding: 
 
Option to build in some customization to each workshop. For example, shorten to 45 mins if possible, and ensuring sessions are conducive to a live audience and pre-recorded sessions. 
Sure. Customizations start at $750 depending on the level of customization. That covers a lot. 
Is there a list of what it covers?
 
We would need to have a detailed conversation around what you need. 
What we are most interested in is shortening the sessions to 45 min. Also, this might already be accounted for, but want to make sure the recording is conducive to someone watching the replay (i.e., if there is a 5 min breakout session, the viewer will not have to wait 5 min for the breakout session to take place). 
Ability to have recordings available on our employee intranet for 1 year 
Yes. We can do that. Does your platform allow for SCORM files or will you need a simple recording?
 
We will need an .mov or .mp4 file
On our call you mentioned the price would vary based on audience size. What audience size does the current proposal reflect? 
The predicted audience size only impacts the cost of the recorded session. We price those like elearnings, based on audience size. If you can remind me of the audience size I can price that out.
 
The expected number of replays is 2,000 employees
We didn’t discuss this on our call but curious if you have any existing resources available for post-election programming. 
We are building a course on Civility in Dialog, with the recent political polarization in mind. Simply put, how do we remain civil in what some consider uncivil times.  And we will soon have a Religious Inclusion course for folks who are feeling left out of conversations around inclusion in the workplace.
 
Thanks for the insight. What is the anticipated availability date for these sessions? 
 
Let me know if I can clarify anything and feel free to call me with questions. 
 
Thanks again!
 
Jenny 
 
 
JENNY JONES
Community Partnerships 
Equality & Belonging
(303) 550-2241

Hi team – just got this email from Melio, who we use for international wires. FYI in case they don’t restore the service and we hit up against some vendor payment problems. I’ll keep you updated on any developments.
 
SG
 
From:
 The Melio Team <info@melio.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 18, 2025 09:07
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Important update regarding international payments
 
We are switching to a new payments provider, affecting international payments. 
͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏ ͏
 
Hi LCW,
We're making some updates to our systems, as we obtain state money transmission licenses. To facilitate these updates, we're moving to a new international payments provider. 
That means starting March 3rd, 2025, we'll be temporarily pausing international payments. After that, you won't be able to send payments to international vendors through Melio. Any payment scheduled for or after March 3rd, 2025, will not be processed. 
We understand this may impact you business, and we're working hard to restore this service as quickly as possible. We'll notify you as soon as international payments are back. 
We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. 
The Melio Team. 
​

124 East 14th St., New York, NY 10003

subject: Important update regarding international payments
body:
We are switching to a new payments provider, affecting international payments.

Hi LCW,
We're making some updates to our systems, as we obtain state money transmission licenses. To facilitate these updates, we're moving to a new international payments provider. 
That means starting March 3rd, 2025, we'll be temporarily pausing international payments. After that, you won't be able to send payments to international vendors through Melio. Any payment scheduled for or after March 3rd, 2025, will not be processed. 
We understand this may impact you business, and we're working hard to restore this service as quickly as possible. We'll notify you as soon as international payments are back. 
We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. 
The Melio Team.

Subject:
 Canceling Bill.com subscription
 
 
Hi Alisa and Nicole,
 
We’re all set to cancel our Bill.com subscription. This is simple to do, but can only be done by an admin (one of you). Here are the steps:
Log in to Bill.com
In the menu bar on the left, click on “Settings”
In the menu bar on the left, click on “Billing & Subscription”, then “Features”
Select “I only want to send payments to BILL users” and “I only want to receive payments from BILL users”
 
That should do it (though I don’t have this in my menus, so I don’t know exactly what it looks like) – let me know if you run into any issues. Our current month ends on February 11
th
 so we have until then before we get charged again. Let me know when it’s done and I’ll check to be sure it did what we want. I’m also happy to do this on a call tomorrow.
 
“SG” Gluckstein

Hi Chuck, 
 
After regrouping internally, we wanted to see if it would be possible to update the SOW to include the recording for 
Spotlight on the African American Community
 only. At the end of February, we can reevaluate adding recordings for the remaining four sessions based on the number of replays from BHM. The 2,000 audience size figure was an educated estimate, and we’d appreciate the opportunity to measure replays to provide a more accurate number.
 
We also understand that the 50% discount was contingent upon purchasing five courses. In good faith, we were hoping you might consider honoring the discount for BHM with the understanding that we plan to purchase the additional four courses once we have a better sense of replay engagement.
 
For BHM, we’d like to schedule the session for the first week of February and can coordinate specific dates based on mutual availability.
 
Lastly, please let us know who your accounting contact is so we can start getting LCW set up with EVED, our payment platform. 
 
Thank you very much for your consideration. We look forward to hearing your thoughts.
 
Jenny

I appreciate the opportunity to clarify. I should have been more precise. The regular pricing for a recording kept for one year is $10,500 per course for the audience suggested. Given that you folks are purchasing 5 courses and that Tish is a valued partner we can reduce that by 50% for each course, or $5,250 for each recording for access for up to 2,000 learners over 12 months.

Chuck

Thank you, Chuck!
 
Can you please confirm that the incremental $10,500 would be inclusive of all 5 recorded sessions? If so, we would love to move forward with getting a contract in place for the 5 sessions with Basic customization and recording replay usage for 1 year (from date of each event). 
 
Additional notes to include in the contract (if you are aligned): 
Zoom webinar to be managed by Gap Inc. (i.e., Gap Inc. will host the Zoom webinar and create the recording, with LCW facilitator(s) as panelists, utilizing Gap Inc AV support). 
Session dates to be scheduled within the first week of each Heritage Month with the final date to be aligned on with all parties 30 days prior to event
 
Please let me know if you are aligned to the above. We would love to finalize the contract this week if possible so we can move forward to invoicing and processing payment by end of January. 
 
Thanks again, 
 
Jenny

Subject:
 Re: [External]LCW & Gap Follow up: Spotlight Previews
 
Hi Pedro, 
 
This is great, thank you for sending. Below I’ve outlined a few follow-up questions + notes around what we’d like to explore adding: 
 
Option to build in some customization to each workshop. For example, shorten to 45 mins if possible, and ensuring sessions are conducive to a live audience and pre-recorded sessions. 
Sure. Customizations start at $750 depending on the level of customization. That covers a lot. 
Is there a list of what it covers?
 
We would need to have a detailed conversation around what you need. 
What we are most interested in is shortening the sessions to 45 min. Also, this might already be accounted for, but want to make sure the recording is conducive to someone watching the replay (i.e., if there is a 5 min breakout session, the viewer will not have to wait 5 min for the breakout session to take place). 
Ability to have recordings available on our employee intranet for 1 year 
Yes. We can do that. Does your platform allow for SCORM files or will you need a simple recording?
 
We will need an .mov or .mp4 file
On our call you mentioned the price would vary based on audience size. What audience size does the current proposal reflect? 
The predicted audience size only impacts the cost of the recorded session. We price those like elearnings, based on audience size. If you can remind me of the audience size I can price that out.
 
The expected number of replays is 2,000 employees
We didn’t discuss this on our call but curious if you have any existing resources available for post-election programming. 
We are building a course on Civility in Dialog, with the recent political polarization in mind. Simply put, how do we remain civil in what some consider uncivil times.  And we will soon have a Religious Inclusion course for folks who are feeling left out of conversations around inclusion in the workplace.
 
Thanks for the insight. What is the anticipated availability date for these sessions? 
 
Let me know if I can clarify anything and feel free to call me with questions. 
 
Thanks again!
 
Jenny 
 
 
JENNY JONES
Community Partnerships 
Equality & Belonging
(303) 550-2241

We also understand that the 50% discount was contingent upon purchasing five courses. In good faith, we were hoping you might consider honoring the discount for BHM with the understanding that we plan to purchase the additional four courses once we have a better sense of replay engagement.
 
For BHM, we’d like to schedule the session for the first week of February and can coordinate specific dates based on mutual availability.
 
Lastly, please let us know who your accounting contact is so we can start getting LCW set up with EVED, our payment platform. 
 
Thank you very much for your consideration. We look forward to hearing your thoughts.
 
Jenny

Subject:
 Re: [External]LCW & Gap Follow up: Spotlight Previews
 
Hi Pedro, 
 
This is great, thank you for sending. Below I’ve outlined a few follow-up questions + notes around what we’d like to explore adding: 
 
Option to build in some customization to each workshop. For example, shorten to 45 mins if possible, and ensuring sessions are conducive to a live audience and pre-recorded sessions. 
Sure. Customizations start at $750 depending on the level of customization. That covers a lot. 
Is there a list of what it covers?
 
We would need to have a detailed conversation around what you need. 
What we are most interested in is shortening the sessions to 45 min. Also, this might already be accounted for, but want to make sure the recording is conducive to someone watching the replay (i.e., if there is a 5 min breakout session, the viewer will not have to wait 5 min for the breakout session to take place). 
Ability to have recordings available on our employee intranet for 1 year 
Yes. We can do that. Does your platform allow for SCORM files or will you need a simple recording?
 
We will need an .mov or .mp4 file
On our call you mentioned the price would vary based on audience size. What audience size does the current proposal reflect? 
The predicted audience size only impacts the cost of the recorded session. We price those like elearnings, based on audience size. If you can remind me of the audience size I can price that out.
 
The expected number of replays is 2,000 employees
We didn’t discuss this on our call but curious if you have any existing resources available for post-election programming. 
We are building a course on Civility in Dialog, with the recent political polarization in mind. Simply put, how do we remain civil in what some consider uncivil times.  And we will soon have a Religious Inclusion course for folks who are feeling left out of conversations around inclusion in the workplace.
 
Thanks for the insight. What is the anticipated availability date for these sessions? 
 
Let me know if I can clarify anything and feel free to call me with questions. 
 
Thanks again!
 
Jenny 
 
 
JENNY JONES
Community Partnerships 
Equality & Belonging
(303) 550-2241

Hi again 
🙂
.
 
When I click on Features, I don't see the options you mention below. See screenshot.
 
I did some Googling & totally see the instructions below outlined as what to do, but I don't see that language anywhere when I'm on the site.
 
I do see a place under "My Subscription" that looks like it allows us to cancel our AP & AR subscription - see attached...but I don't know if that's what we want....?
 
I've tried looking elsewhere online & in Bill.com but have not had luck yet. I'll keep you posted!
 
From:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Thursday, January 30, 2025 3:36 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>; Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Canceling Bill.com subscription
 
 
Hi Alisa and Nicole,
 
We’re all set to cancel our Bill.com subscription. This is simple to do, but can only be done by an admin (one of you). Here are the steps:
Log in to Bill.com
In the menu bar on the left, click on “Settings”
In the menu bar on the left, click on “Billing & Subscription”, then “Features”
Select “I only want to send payments to BILL users” and “I only want to receive payments from BILL users”
 
That should do it (though I don’t have this in my menus, so I don’t know exactly what it looks like) – let me know if you run into any issues. Our current month ends on February 11
th
 so we have until then before we get charged again. Let me know when it’s done and I’ll check to be sure it did what we want. I’m also happy to do this on a call tomorrow.
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW

accounting@lcwmail.com

c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: Please review: Draft 1099
 
Hello Sarah,
 
Thank you for sending over the 1099; I have identified two errors and more more significant. Based upon this 1099, I only received 3 payments and I should have received four.  My contract with LCW was $6,500/month for March and April. I went through my records in Bill.com and it confirms that I received payment for April and only one payment in May when I worked the entirety of April. I am owed $3,250.
 
Please also find that my business address is:
5014 La Cienega St NW
Albuquerque, NM 87107
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.

Howdy Nicole,
 
Greetings from San Antonio, Texas! Rainier here, and I'm happy to help you today!
 
I've reviewed the details of your ticket and will ensure a smooth continuation from where we last left off. 
 
Taking a look, I see that you're trying to regain the access of the Squarespace account that manages 
lcwmail.consulting
.
 
No worries, we can assist in transferring the ownership of the account. 
 
To continue helping in the most secure way possible, I’ll need to verify your identity as the owner of the site. To do that, I’ll need two pieces of information. Could you reply with a picture, scan, or .pdf of:
1) A bank statement or credit card statement that includes your most recent payment for a Squarespace subscription. The statement must include:
- A header showing the banking institution that issued it
- The bank account holder name
- A line item for your most recent payment to Squarespace or SQSP, including the charge date and amount
If you purchased the Squarespace subscription with PayPal, the PayPal statement should include:
- The full header of the PayPal statement
- The PayPal account holder name
- The line item for your most recent payment to Squarespace or SQSP, including the charge date and amount
2) A government-issued ID displaying your name, such as a driver’s license, passport, or permanent resident card.
You’re free to redact or blur any extra information from the statement or ID as long as we can see the details listed above. We’ll fully redact the files from our system after evaluating them. We only use these images for identification purposes, and won’t share or distribute them outside of our secure system.
 
I want to make sure everything is in order for you so let me know if there is anything you need! I'll keep an eye out for your response.
 
Best, 
Rainier F.

Hi there!
 
Is this something you can help me with...? I would like to set up my HSA so that I can make contributions from my paycheck.
I'm the only LCW FTE with an HSA plan. 
 
https://quickbooks.intuit.com/learn-support/en-us/help-article/payroll-setup/set-health-savings-account-hsa-plans/L3ZOGf8TY_US_en_US
 - Here's the instructions I found online to make the deductions from my paycheck.
I'd like the pre-tax option 
🙂
.
 
The annual maximum for 2025 is $4,300.
As for amount or percentage... Is it possible to deduct $700 per pay period/paycheck until I reach the maximum amount?
The bank account/routing #s are attached - I got them from Health Equity.
 
Lastly, in order for this to work, it looks like we need to have the PPD option chosen on our account. I can't tell if it's already chosen, but I believe it is. If it's not, I can call to activate this option. 
 
I've not done an HSA deduction setup before & am assuming you have. If not, and you want me to do it, I can. It just felt a little weird setting it up for myself 
🙂
.
 
Thanks so much!
Nicole

 Monday, February 3, 2025 10:40 AM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: HSA set up in Quickbooks
 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
This is not something I have experience with, and I don’t know much about our benefits administration, but I would think it would be handled through Zenefits payroll, like your healthcare deductions. Happy to work on it together.
 
SG
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Saturday, February 1, 2025 13:46
To:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 HSA set up in Quickbooks
 
Hi there!
 
Is this something you can help me with...? I would like to set up my HSA so that I can make contributions from my paycheck.
I'm the only LCW FTE with an HSA plan. 
 
https://quickbooks.intuit.com/learn-support/en-us/help-article/payroll-setup/set-health-savings-account-hsa-plans/L3ZOGf8TY_US_en_US
 - Here's the instructions I found online to make the deductions from my paycheck.
I'd like the pre-tax option 
🙂
.
 
The annual maximum for 2025 is $4,300.
As for amount or percentage... Is it possible to deduct $700 per pay period/paycheck until I reach the maximum amount?
The bank account/routing #s are attached - I got them from Health Equity.
 
Lastly, in order for this to work, it looks like we need to have the PPD option chosen on our account. I can't tell if it's already chosen, but I believe it is. If it's not, I can call to activate this option. 
 
I've not done an HSA deduction setup before & am assuming you have. If not, and you want me to do it, I can. It just felt a little weird setting it up for myself 
🙂
.
 
Thanks so much!
Nicole
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: Fw: [Support] Re: $6 charge to our company
body:
Hi there!
I'm still trying to stop this $6/7 monthly payment to Squarespace.
Please see below in blue & the previous email.
You had given me some info before (attached). Can you help with the rest? 
I highlighted in yellow in the previous email what we need to give to Squarespace. As for #2, the ID, their clarification is what's here in blue.
This is NOT urgent at all & can wait.
Hope this makes sense 🙂.
Thank you!
To clarify- we consider the person paying to be the owner. So the name on the statement should match the ID, and if your name isn't the one on the statement you'll want to have them reach out to us instead. 
 
If the statement includes a company name instead of a person's name that's okay, you can send your ID and the statement. 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

From:
 Squarespace Customer Care <customercare@squarespace.com>
Sent:
 Thursday, February 13, 2025 4:10 PM
To:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 [Support] Re: $6 charge to our company
 
 
##- Please type your reply above this line -##
Your request (11629549) has been updated. To add additional comments, reply to this email.
Rainier F.
 (Squarespace)
Feb 13, 2025, 4:10 PM EST
Howdy Nicole,
 
Greetings from San Antonio, Texas! Rainier here, and I'm happy to help you today!
 
I've reviewed the details of your ticket and will ensure a smooth continuation from where we last left off. 
 
Taking a look, I see that you're trying to regain the access of the Squarespace account that manages 
lcwmail.consulting
.
 
No worries, we can assist in transferring the ownership of the account. 
 
To continue helping in the most secure way possible, I’ll need to verify your identity as the owner of the site. To do that, I’ll need two pieces of information. Could you reply with a picture, scan, or .pdf of:
1) A bank statement or credit card statement that includes your most recent payment for a Squarespace subscription. The statement must include:
- A header showing the banking institution that issued it
- The bank account holder name
- A line item for your most recent payment to Squarespace or SQSP, including the charge date and amount
If you purchased the Squarespace subscription with PayPal, the PayPal statement should include:
- The full header of the PayPal statement
- The PayPal account holder name
- The line item for your most recent payment to Squarespace or SQSP, including the charge date and amount
2) A government-issued ID displaying your name, such as a driver’s license, passport, or permanent resident card.
You’re free to redact or blur any extra information from the statement or ID as long as we can see the details listed above. We’ll fully redact the files from our system after evaluating them. We only use these images for identification purposes, and won’t share or distribute them outside of our secure system.
 
I want to make sure everything is in order for you so let me know if there is anything you need! I'll keep an eye out for your response.
 
Best, 
Rainier F.
She/her/hers
"I eat dessert before main course!"
http://support.squarespace.com
[VV06KX-74M0R]

subject: Re: Banking info & Payments - LCW
body:
Hi again.
Just an FYI that I usually ask for the W9 when setting up, but you can ask too in case I forget. Also, I do require W8s to be completed for international non-US taxpayers. Just wanted you to know. I have the W8 for Jorgelina & will save in DB.
Thanks! 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW
Website
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
View our upcoming events
 | 
Sign-up for our newsletter
From:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Monday, February 10, 2025 12:47 PM
To:
 Jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com <jorgelina.venturi@gmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Banking info & Payments - LCW
 
 
Hi Jorgelina! Glad to have you on board.
 
To get started, I will need the name and physical address of your bank in the US. Once I have that, I can send you an invitation through QuickBooks Money to manage your own bank account information. Or if you prefer, you can send me the routing and account numbers and I’ll input manually.
 
I’m assuming that since you don’t live in the US, you don’t file taxes here? If that’s the case, then all I need is the bank account info. If you are a US taxpayer, I need your form W9.
 
I have attached the Q1 time sheet for you. You’ll submit this twice a month (after the 15
th
 and after the 1
st
) to Nicole for approval (attaching a copy of the file), and pay is processed about the 1
st
 or 15
th
 half a month after the sheet is submitted (usually takes a few days to get into the account). Please let me know if you have any questions about how to fill it out, we can always hop on a call. For this one you’ll start filling out in the first half of February. I’ll send out a new one at the end of March to start using in April.
 
Let me know if you need anything else!
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW
Email: 
accounting@lcwmail.com

 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>

Hello again Jorgelina,
 
I'm copying in SG (our bookkeeper) so they can help with your bank info.
SG will send you what she needs & will explain our payment process. 
I can help jump in when I'm back on Thursday as well.
 
Thanks to you both!
Nicole
 
Nicole Barile

Best,
SG

 Monday, February 10, 2025 5:32 PM
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Weekly Accounting update 2/10/25
 
Hi team,
 
Attached are this week’s updated reports – no video this week since there’s not anything new really. The BSC prepayment is now AR, so the future invoice predictions for them have been reduced, but we know when the cash will arrive.
 
If I can get any information on planned translation projects (including invoicing and COGS) that will help beef up the forecast, since we do consistently profit on that. Failing that, we can just keep in mind there’s a bit of that each month.
 
Alisa, we’ll touch base tomorrow to plan the 2/15 payables, which are all included in the forecast. If you want to we could also talk about setting aside some cash in a “last resort” account to be sure it’s there for wrapping up payroll and high priority vendor bills, which is a thing Chuck mentioned.
 
“SG” Gluckstein

subject: Weekly Accounting update 2/10/25
body:
Hi team,
 
Attached are this week’s updated reports – no video this week since there’s not anything new really. The BSC prepayment is now AR, so the future invoice predictions for them have been reduced, but we know when the cash will arrive.
 
If I can get any information on planned translation projects (including invoicing and COGS) that will help beef up the forecast, since we do consistently profit on that. Failing that, we can just keep in mind there’s a bit of that each month.
 
Alisa, we’ll touch base tomorrow to plan the 2/15 payables, which are all included in the forecast. If you want to we could also talk about setting aside some cash in a “last resort” account to be sure it’s there for wrapping up payroll and high priority vendor bills, which is a thing Chuck mentioned.
 
“SG” Gluckstein
 
(they/them)
Accountant
LCW

 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com>

Hi SG,
 
I have a Bank of America account and I pay taxes in Argentina, where i live.
 
Please find the bank information below and let me know if you need anything else.
Kind regards,
Lina
 
On Mon, 10 Feb 2025 at 2:47
 
PM Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
Hi Jorgelina! Glad to have you on board.
 
To get started, I will need the name and physical address of your bank in the US. Once I have that, I can send you an invitation through QuickBooks Money to manage your own bank account information. Or if you prefer, you can send me the routing and account numbers and I’ll input manually.
 
I’m assuming that since you don’t live in the US, you don’t file taxes here? If that’s the case, then all I need is the bank account info. If you are a US taxpayer, I need your form W9.
 
I have attached the Q1 time sheet for you. You’ll submit this twice a month (after the 15
th
 and after the 1
st
) to Nicole for approval (attaching a copy of the file), and pay is processed about the 1
st
 or 15
th
 half a month after the sheet is submitted (usually takes a few days to get into the account). Please let me know if you have any questions about how to fill it out, we can always hop on a call. For this one you’ll start filling out in the first half of February. I’ll send out a new one at the end of March to start using in April.
 
Let me know if you need anything else!
 
“SG” Gluckstein

LCW

subject: Kohler - IMPORTANT User Account Upgrade : LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC / Kohler - WICHTIG Upgrade des Benutzerkontos: LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
body:
Dear LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
You are receiving this email because you have an active profile on the Kohler Supplier Management Platform.
We are excited to announce two new enhancements to our Supplier Management Platform (Powered by Jaggaer), which will provide added levels of security to protect your data.
Supplier Identity Management (IDM)
Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).
This upgrade is in line with industry standards and aims to provide you with the necessary tools to protect your account.
Supplier Identify Manager will also enable you to manage multiple accounts with us if you’re managing separate divisions or global operations with Kohler.
When is this happening?
This enhancement will be effective from 
10
th
 February 2025
.
What actions are required from you?
The next time you log in to your profile, you will see the message 
“Your Account Has Been Upgraded to JAGGAER Global Identity”
You will be prompted to reset your password.
 This will come from no-reply@jaggaer.com
Please follow the step-by-step instructions in the attached document to complete this process
Portal Link:
https://app11.jaggaer.com/portal/kohlerco/?pp_login=1&cid=225221
If you have any questions please contact 
SMPSupport@kohler.com
Thank you for being a Kohler Valuable Supplier,
Kohler Global Procurement
Ref: Document - Documents Notification - Supplier IDM
 
--------------
Sehr geehrter geschätzter Lieferant
LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
Sie erhalten diese E-Mail, weil Sie ein aktives Profil auf der Kohler Supplier Management Platform besitzen.
Wir freuen uns, zwei neue Verbesserungen an unserer Supplier Management Platform (Powered by Jaggaer) anzukündigen, die zusätzliche Sicherheitsebenen bieten, um Ihre Daten zu schützen.
Lieferanten-Identitätsmanagement (IDM)
Mehrfaktor-Authentifizierung (MFA).
Dieses Upgrade entspricht den Branchenstandards und soll Ihnen die notwendigen Tools bieten, um Ihr Konto zu schützen.
Der Supplier Identity Manager wird es Ihnen auch ermöglichen, mehrere Konten bei uns zu verwalten, falls Sie separate Abteilungen oder globale Geschäftsbereiche von Kohler betreuen.
Wann passiert das?
Diese Verbesserung wird ab dem 
10. Februar 2025
 wirksam.
Welche Maßnahmen sind von Ihnen erforderlich?
Das nächste Mal, wenn Sie sich in Ihr Profil einloggen, werden Sie die Nachricht 
„Ihr Konto wurde auf JAGGAER Globale Identität aktualisiert“ 
sehen.
Sie werden aufgefordert, Ihr Passwort zurückzusetzen.
 Diese Aufforderung kommt von 
no-reply@jaggaer.com
Bitte folgen Sie den Schritt-für-Schritt-Anweisungen im beigefügten Dokument, um diesen Prozess abzuschließen.
Portal Link:
https://app11.jaggaer.com/portal/kohlerco/?pp_login=1&cid=225221
 
Wenn Sie Fragen haben oder Unterstützung benötigen, wenden Sie sich bitte an  
SMPSupport@kohler.com 
Mit freundlichen Grüßen,
Kohler Global Procurement

Nice to be connected with you! Sorry for the delay, it seems our whole team has been sick this week with the flu. I am looking at your account and your 24 month term was up for renewal back in October with a 2 month notice period. I am going to escalate this to leadership for you tomorrow & see what we can do. Thanks for your patience as I look into this further.
